170 FORCEINLINE
171 ULONG
172 POOLTAG_HASH (
173  IN ULONG Key,
174  IN SIZE_T Mask
175  )
176 
177 /*++
178 
179 Routine Description:
180 
181  This function builds a hash table index based on the supplied pool
182  tag.
183 
184 Arguments:
185 
186  Key - Supplies the key value to hash.
187 
188  Mask - Supplies the mask value to apply to the resultant key to generate
189  a valid hash table index.
190  PoolDescriptor - Supplies a pointer to the pool descriptor.
191 
192 Return Value:
193 
194  None.
195 
196 --*/
197 {
198  ULONG64 hash;
199 
200  hash = (ULONG64)Key * 40543;
201  hash ^= hash >> 32;
202  return (ULONG)(hash & Mask);
203 }

313 //
314 // The pool descriptor for nonpaged pool is static.
315 // The pool descriptors for paged pool are dynamically allocated
316 // since there can be more than one paged pool. There is always one more
317 // paged pool descriptor than there are paged pools. This descriptor is
318 // used when a page allocation is done for a paged pool and is the first
319 // descriptor in the paged pool descriptor array.
320 //
321 
322 POOL_DESCRIPTOR NonPagedPoolDescriptor;
323 
324 #define EXP_MAXIMUM_POOL_NODES 16
325 
326 PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR ExpNonPagedPoolDescriptor[EXP_MAXIMUM_POOL_NODES];
327 
328 //
329 // The pool vector contains an array of pointers to pool descriptors. For
330 // nonpaged pool this is just a pointer to the nonpaged pool descriptor.
331 // For paged pool, this is a pointer to an array of pool descriptors.
332 // The pointer to the paged pool descriptor is duplicated so
333 // it can be found easily by the kernel debugger.
334 //
335 
336 PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR PoolVector[NUMBER_OF_POOLS];

373 #define LOCK_POOL(PoolDesc, LockHandle) { \
374  if ((PoolDesc->PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == NonPagedPool) { \
375  if (PoolDesc == &NonPagedPoolDescriptor) { \
376  LockHandle.OldIrql = KeAcquireQueuedSpinLock(LockQueueNonPagedPoolLock); \
377  } \
378  else { \
379  ASSERT (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 1); \
380  KeAcquireInStackQueuedSpinLock (PoolDesc->LockAddress, &LockHandle); \
381  } \
382  } \
383  else { \
384  KeAcquireGuardedMutex ((PKGUARDED_MUTEX)PoolDesc->LockAddress); \
385  } \
386 }
387 
388 
389 
390 #define UNLOCK_POOL(PoolDesc, LockHandle) { \
391  if ((PoolDesc->PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == NonPagedPool) { \
392  if (PoolDesc == &NonPagedPoolDescriptor) { \
393  KeReleaseQueuedSpinLock(LockQueueNonPagedPoolLock, LockHandle.OldIrql); \
394  } \
395  else { \
396  ASSERT (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 1); \
397  KeReleaseInStackQueuedSpinLock (&LockHandle); \
398  } \
399  } \
400  else { \
401  KeReleaseGuardedMutex ((PKGUARDED_MUTEX)PoolDesc->LockAddress); \
402  } \
403 }

405 #ifndef NO_POOL_CHECKS

407 
408 //
409 // We redefine the LIST_ENTRY macros to have each pointer biased
410 // by one so any rogue code using these pointers will access
411 // violate. See \nt\public\sdk\inc\ntrtl.h for the original
412 // definition of these macros.
413 //
414 // This is turned off in the shipping product.
415 //
416 
417 #define DecodeLink(Link) ((PLIST_ENTRY)((ULONG_PTR)(Link) & ~1))
418 #define EncodeLink(Link) ((PLIST_ENTRY)((ULONG_PTR)(Link) | 1))
419 
420 #define PrivateInitializeListHead(ListHead) ( \
421  (ListHead)->Flink = (ListHead)->Blink = EncodeLink(ListHead))
422 
423 #define PrivateIsListEmpty(ListHead) \
424  (DecodeLink((ListHead)->Flink) == (ListHead))
425 
426 #define PrivateRemoveHeadList(ListHead) \
427  DecodeLink((ListHead)->Flink); \
428  {PrivateRemoveEntryList(DecodeLink((ListHead)->Flink))}
429 
430 #define PrivateRemoveTailList(ListHead) \
431  DecodeLink((ListHead)->Blink); \
432  {PrivateRemoveEntryList(DecodeLink((ListHead)->Blink))}
433 
434 #define PrivateRemoveEntryList(Entry) { \
435  PLIST_ENTRY _EX_Blink; \
436  PLIST_ENTRY _EX_Flink; \
437  _EX_Flink = DecodeLink((Entry)->Flink); \
438  _EX_Blink = DecodeLink((Entry)->Blink); \
439  _EX_Blink->Flink = EncodeLink(_EX_Flink); \
440  _EX_Flink->Blink = EncodeLink(_EX_Blink); \
441  }
442 
443 #define CHECK_LIST(LIST) \
444  if ((DecodeLink(DecodeLink((LIST)->Flink)->Blink) != (LIST)) || \
445  (DecodeLink(DecodeLink((LIST)->Blink)->Flink) != (LIST))) { \
446  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER, \
447  3, \
448  (ULONG_PTR)LIST, \
449  (ULONG_PTR)DecodeLink(DecodeLink((LIST)->Flink)->Blink), \
450  (ULONG_PTR)DecodeLink(DecodeLink((LIST)->Blink)->Flink)); \
451  }
452 
453 #define PrivateInsertTailList(ListHead,Entry) { \
454  PLIST_ENTRY _EX_Blink; \
455  PLIST_ENTRY _EX_ListHead; \
456  _EX_ListHead = (ListHead); \
457  CHECK_LIST(_EX_ListHead); \
458  _EX_Blink = DecodeLink(_EX_ListHead->Blink); \
459  (Entry)->Flink = EncodeLink(_EX_ListHead); \
460  (Entry)->Blink = EncodeLink(_EX_Blink); \
461  _EX_Blink->Flink = EncodeLink(Entry); \
462  _EX_ListHead->Blink = EncodeLink(Entry); \
463  CHECK_LIST(_EX_ListHead); \
464  }
465 
466 #define PrivateInsertHeadList(ListHead,Entry) { \
467  PLIST_ENTRY _EX_Flink; \
468  PLIST_ENTRY _EX_ListHead; \
469  _EX_ListHead = (ListHead); \
470  CHECK_LIST(_EX_ListHead); \
471  _EX_Flink = DecodeLink(_EX_ListHead->Flink); \
472  (Entry)->Flink = EncodeLink(_EX_Flink); \
473  (Entry)->Blink = EncodeLink(_EX_ListHead); \
474  _EX_Flink->Blink = EncodeLink(Entry); \
475  _EX_ListHead->Flink = EncodeLink(Entry); \
476  CHECK_LIST(_EX_ListHead); \
477  }

479 VOID
480 FORCEINLINE
481 ExCheckPoolHeader (
482  IN PPOOL_HEADER Entry
483  )
484 {
485  PPOOL_HEADER PreviousEntry;
486  PPOOL_HEADER NextEntry;
487 
488  if (Entry->PreviousSize != 0) {
489 
490  PreviousEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry - Entry->PreviousSize);
491  if (PAGE_ALIGN (Entry) != PAGE_ALIGN (PreviousEntry)) {
492  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
493  6,
494  (ULONG_PTR) PreviousEntry,
495  __LINE__,
496  (ULONG_PTR)Entry);
497  }
498 
499  if ((PreviousEntry->BlockSize != Entry->PreviousSize) ||
500  (DECODE_POOL_INDEX(PreviousEntry) != DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry))) {
501 
502  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
503  5,
504  (ULONG_PTR) PreviousEntry,
505  __LINE__,
506  (ULONG_PTR)Entry);
507  }
508  }
509  else if (!PAGE_ALIGNED (Entry)) {
510  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
511  7,
512  0,
513  __LINE__,
514  (ULONG_PTR)Entry);
515  }
516 
517  if (Entry->BlockSize == 0) {
518  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
519  8,
520  0,
521  __LINE__,
522  (ULONG_PTR)Entry);
523  }
524 
525  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + Entry->BlockSize);
526 
527  if (!PAGE_END(NextEntry)) {
528 
529  if (PAGE_ALIGN (Entry) != PAGE_ALIGN (NextEntry)) {
530  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
531  9,
532  (ULONG_PTR) NextEntry,
533  __LINE__,
534  (ULONG_PTR)Entry);
535  }
536 
537  if ((NextEntry->PreviousSize != (Entry)->BlockSize) ||
538  (DECODE_POOL_INDEX(NextEntry) != DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry))) {
539 
540  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
541  5,
542  (ULONG_PTR) NextEntry,
543  __LINE__,
544  (ULONG_PTR)Entry);
545  }
546  }
547 }
548 
549 #define CHECK_POOL_HEADER(ENTRY) ExCheckPoolHeader(ENTRY)
550 
551 #define ASSERT_ALLOCATE_IRQL(_PoolType, _NumberOfBytes) \
552  if ((_PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) { \
553  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > APC_LEVEL) { \
554  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER, 8, KeGetCurrentIrql(), _PoolType, _NumberOfBytes); \
555  } \
556  } \
557  else { \
558  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > DISPATCH_LEVEL) { \
559  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER, 8, KeGetCurrentIrql(), _PoolType, _NumberOfBytes); \
560  } \
561  }
562 
563 #define ASSERT_FREE_IRQL(_PoolType, _P) \
564  if ((_PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) { \
565  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > APC_LEVEL) { \
566  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER, 9, KeGetCurrentIrql(), _PoolType, (ULONG_PTR)_P); \
567  } \
568  } \
569  else { \
570  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > DISPATCH_LEVEL) { \
571  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER, 9, KeGetCurrentIrql(), _PoolType, (ULONG_PTR)P); \
572  } \
573  }
574 
575 #define ASSERT_POOL_NOT_FREE(_Entry) \
576  if ((_Entry->PoolType & POOL_TYPE_MASK) == 0) { \
577  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER, 6, __LINE__, (ULONG_PTR)_Entry, _Entry->Ulong1); \
578  }
579 
580 #define ASSERT_POOL_TYPE_NOT_ZERO(_Entry) \
581  if (_Entry->PoolType == 0) { \
582  KeBugCheckEx(BAD_POOL_CALLER, 1, (ULONG_PTR)_Entry, (ULONG_PTR)(*(PULONG)_Entry), 0); \
583  }
584 
585 #define CHECK_POOL_PAGE(PAGE) \
586  { \
587  PPOOL_HEADER P = (PPOOL_HEADER)PAGE_ALIGN(PAGE); \
588  ULONG SIZE = 0; \
589  LOGICAL FOUND=FALSE; \
590  ASSERT (P->PreviousSize == 0); \
591  do { \
592  if (P == (PPOOL_HEADER)PAGE) { \
593  FOUND = TRUE; \
594  } \
595  CHECK_POOL_HEADER(P); \
596  SIZE += P->BlockSize; \
597  P = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)P + P->BlockSize); \
598  } while ((SIZE < (PAGE_SIZE / POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK)) && \
599  (PAGE_END(P) == FALSE)); \
600  if ((PAGE_END(P) == FALSE) || (FOUND == FALSE)) { \
601  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER, 0xA, (ULONG_PTR) PAGE, __LINE__, (ULONG_PTR) P); \
602  } \
603  }
604 
605 #else
606 
607 #define DecodeLink(Link) ((PLIST_ENTRY)((ULONG_PTR)(Link)))
608 #define EncodeLink(Link) ((PLIST_ENTRY)((ULONG_PTR)(Link)))
609 #define PrivateInitializeListHead InitializeListHead
610 #define PrivateIsListEmpty IsListEmpty

612 #define PrivateRemoveTailList RemoveTailList
613 #define PrivateRemoveEntryList RemoveEntryList
614 #define PrivateInsertTailList InsertTailList
615 #define PrivateInsertHeadList InsertHeadList
616 
617 #define ASSERT_ALLOCATE_IRQL(_PoolType, _P) {NOTHING;}
618 #define ASSERT_FREE_IRQL(_PoolType, _P) {NOTHING;}
619 #define ASSERT_POOL_NOT_FREE(_Entry) {NOTHING;}
620 #define ASSERT_POOL_TYPE_NOT_ZERO(_Entry) {NOTHING;}

622 //
623 // The check list macros come in two flavors - there is one in the checked
624 // and free build that will bugcheck the system if a list is ill-formed, and
625 // there is one for the final shipping version that has all the checked
626 // disabled.
627 //
628 // The check lookaside list macros also comes in two flavors and is used to
629 // verify that the look aside lists are well formed.
630 //
631 // The check pool header macro (two flavors) verifies that the specified
632 // pool header matches the preceding and succeeding pool headers.
633 //
634 
635 #define CHECK_LIST(LIST) {NOTHING;}
636 #define CHECK_POOL_HEADER(ENTRY) {NOTHING;}
637 
638 #define CHECK_POOL_PAGE(PAGE) {NOTHING;}
639 
640 #endif

644 typedef struct _EX_FREE_POOL_TRACES {

658 
659 VOID
660 ExInitializePoolDescriptor (
661  IN PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR PoolDescriptor,
662  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType,
663  IN ULONG PoolIndex,
664  IN ULONG Threshold,
665  IN PVOID PoolLock
666  )
667 
668 /*++
669 
670 Routine Description:
671 
672  This function initializes a pool descriptor.
673 
674  Note that this routine is called directly by the memory manager.
675 
676 Arguments:
677 
678  PoolDescriptor - Supplies a pointer to the pool descriptor.
679 
680  PoolType - Supplies the type of the pool.
681 
682  PoolIndex - Supplies the pool descriptor index.
683 
684  Threshold - Supplies the threshold value for the specified pool.
685 
686  PoolLock - Supplies a pointer to the lock for the specified pool.
687 
688 Return Value:
689 
690  None.
691 
692 --*/
693 
694 {
695  PLIST_ENTRY ListEntry;
696  PLIST_ENTRY LastListEntry;
697  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES p;
698  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES pend;
699 
700  //
701  // Initialize statistics fields, the pool type, the threshold value,
702  // and the lock address.
703  //
704 
705  PoolDescriptor->PoolType = PoolType;
706  PoolDescriptor->PoolIndex = PoolIndex;
707  PoolDescriptor->RunningAllocs = 0;
708  PoolDescriptor->RunningDeAllocs = 0;
709  PoolDescriptor->TotalPages = 0;
710  PoolDescriptor->TotalBytes = 0;
711  PoolDescriptor->TotalBigPages = 0;
712  PoolDescriptor->Threshold = Threshold;
713  PoolDescriptor->LockAddress = PoolLock;
714 
715  PoolDescriptor->PendingFrees = NULL;
716  PoolDescriptor->PendingFreeDepth = 0;
717 
718  //
719  // Initialize the allocation listheads.
720  //
721 
722  ListEntry = PoolDescriptor->ListHeads;
723  LastListEntry = ListEntry + POOL_LIST_HEADS;
724 
725  while (ListEntry < LastListEntry) {
726  PrivateInitializeListHead (ListEntry);
727  ListEntry += 1;
728  }
729 
730  if (PoolType == PagedPoolSession) {
731 
732  if (ExpSessionPoolDescriptor == NULL) {
733  ExpSessionPoolDescriptor = (PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR) MiSessionPoolVector ();
734  ExpSessionPoolLookaside = MiSessionPoolLookaside ();
735 
736  ExpSessionPoolTrackTable = (PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE) MiSessionPoolTrackTable ();
737  ExpSessionPoolTrackTableSize = MiSessionPoolTrackTableSize ();
738  ExpSessionPoolTrackTableMask = ExpSessionPoolTrackTableSize - 1;
739 
740  ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable = (PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES) MiSessionPoolBigPageTable ();
741  ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableSize = MiSessionPoolBigPageTableSize ();
742  ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableHash = ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableSize - 1;
743  ExpSessionPoolSmallLists = MiSessionPoolSmallLists ();
744  }
745 
746  p = &ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[0];
747  pend = p + ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableSize;
748 
749  while (p < pend) {
750  p->Va = (PVOID) POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE;
751  p += 1;
752  }
753  }
754 
755  return;
756 }
757 
758 PVOID
759 ExpDummyAllocate (
760  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType,
761  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
762  IN ULONG Tag
763  );
764 
765 VOID
766 ExDrainPoolLookasideList (
767  IN PPAGED_LOOKASIDE_LIST Lookaside
768  )
769 
770 /*++
771 
772 Routine Description:
773 
774  This function drains the entries from the specified lookaside list.
775 
776  This is needed before deleting a pool lookaside list because the
777  entries on the lookaside are already marked as free (by ExFreePoolWithTag)
778  and so the normal lookaside deletion macros would hit false double free
779  bugchecks if the list is not empty when the macros are called.
780 
781 Arguments:
782 
783  Lookaside - Supplies a pointer to a lookaside list structure.
784 
785 Return Value:
786 
787  None.
788 
789 --*/
790 
791 {
792  PVOID Entry;
793  PPOOL_HEADER PoolHeader;
794 
795  //
796  // Remove all pool entries from the specified lookaside structure,
797  // mark them as active, then free them.
798  //
799 
800  Lookaside->L.Allocate = ExpDummyAllocate;
801 
802  while ((Entry = ExAllocateFromPagedLookasideList(Lookaside)) != NULL) {
803 
804  PoolHeader = (PPOOL_HEADER)Entry - 1;
805 
806  PoolHeader->PoolType = (USHORT)(Lookaside->L.Type + 1);
807  PoolHeader->PoolType |= POOL_IN_USE_MASK;
808 
809  ExpInsertPoolTracker (PoolHeader->PoolTag,
810  PoolHeader->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT,
811  Lookaside->L.Type);
812 
813  //
814  // Set the depth to zero every time as a periodic scan may set it
815  // nonzero. This isn't worth interlocking as the list will absolutely
816  // deplete regardless in this fashion anyway.
817  //
818 
819  Lookaside->L.Depth = 0;
820 
821  (Lookaside->L.Free)(Entry);
822  }
823 
824  return;
825 }
826 
827 //
828 // FREE_CHECK_ERESOURCE - If enabled causes each free pool to verify
829 // no active ERESOURCEs are in the pool block being freed.
830 //
831 // FREE_CHECK_KTIMER - If enabled causes each free pool to verify no
832 // active KTIMERs are in the pool block being freed.
833 //
834 
835 //
836 // Checking for resources in pool being freed is expensive as there can
837 // easily be thousands of resources, so don't do it by default but do
838 // leave the capability for individual systems to enable it.
839 //
840 
841 //
842 // Runtime modifications to these flags must use interlocked sequences.
843 //
844 
845 #if DBG
846 ULONG ExpPoolFlags = EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_TIMERS | \
847  EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_WORKERS;
848 #else
849 ULONG ExpPoolFlags = 0;
850 #endif
851 
852 #define FREE_CHECK_ERESOURCE(Va, NumberOfBytes) \
853  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_RESOURCES) { \
854  ExpCheckForResource(Va, NumberOfBytes); \
855  }
856 
857 #define FREE_CHECK_KTIMER(Va, NumberOfBytes) \
858  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_TIMERS) { \
859  KeCheckForTimer(Va, NumberOfBytes); \
860  }
861 
862 #define FREE_CHECK_WORKER(Va, NumberOfBytes) \
863  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_WORKERS) { \
864  ExpCheckForWorker(Va, NumberOfBytes); \
865  }
866 
867 
868 VOID
869 ExSetPoolFlags (
870  IN ULONG PoolFlag
871  )
872 
873 /*++
874 
875 Routine Description:
876 
877  This procedure enables the specified pool flag(s).
878 
879 Arguments:
880 
881  PoolFlag - Supplies the pool flag(s) to enable.
882 
883 Return Value:
884 
885  None.
886 
887 --*/
888 {
889  RtlInterlockedSetBits (&ExpPoolFlags, PoolFlag);
890 }
891 
892 
893 VOID
894 InitializePool (
895  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType,
896  IN ULONG Threshold
897  )
898 
899 /*++
900 
901 Routine Description:
902 
903  This procedure initializes a pool descriptor for the specified pool
904  type. Once initialized, the pool may be used for allocation and
905  deallocation.
906 
907  This function should be called once for each base pool type during
908  system initialization.
909 
910  Each pool descriptor contains an array of list heads for free
911  blocks. Each list head holds blocks which are a multiple of
912  the POOL_BLOCK_SIZE. The first element on the list [0] links
913  together free entries of size POOL_BLOCK_SIZE, the second element
914  [1] links together entries of POOL_BLOCK_SIZE * 2, the third
915  POOL_BLOCK_SIZE * 3, etc, up to the number of blocks which fit
916  into a page.
917 
918 Arguments:
919 
920  PoolType - Supplies the type of pool being initialized (e.g.
921  nonpaged pool, paged pool...).
922 
923  Threshold - Supplies the threshold value for the specified pool.
924 
925 Return Value:
926 
927  None.
928 
929 --*/
930 
931 {
932  ULONG i;
933  PKSPIN_LOCK SpinLock;
934  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES p;
935  PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR Descriptor;
936  ULONG Index;
937  PKGUARDED_MUTEX GuardedMutex;
938  SIZE_T NumberOfBytes;
939 
940  ASSERT((PoolType & MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == 0);
941 
942  if (PoolType == NonPagedPool) {
943 
944  //
945  // Initialize nonpaged pools.
946  //
947  // Ensure PoolTrackTableSize is a power of 2, then add 1 to it.
948  //
949  // Ensure PoolBigPageTableSize is a power of 2.
950  //
951 
952  NumberOfBytes = PoolTrackTableSize;
953  if (NumberOfBytes > MmSizeOfNonPagedPoolInBytes >> 8) {
954  NumberOfBytes = MmSizeOfNonPagedPoolInBytes >> 8;
955  }
956 
957  for (i = 0; i < 32; i += 1) {
958  if (NumberOfBytes & 0x1) {
959  ASSERT ((NumberOfBytes & ~0x1) == 0);
960  if ((NumberOfBytes & ~0x1) == 0) {
961  break;
962  }
963  }
964  NumberOfBytes >>= 1;
965  }
966 
967  if (i == 32) {
968  PoolTrackTableSize = DEFAULT_TRACKER_TABLE;
969  }
970  else {
971  PoolTrackTableSize = ((SIZE_T)1) << i;
972  if (PoolTrackTableSize < 64) {
973  PoolTrackTableSize = 64;
974  }
975  }
976 
977  do {
978  if (PoolTrackTableSize + 1 > (MAXULONG_PTR / sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE))) {
979  PoolTrackTableSize >>= 1;
980  continue;
981  }
982 
983  PoolTrackTable = MiAllocatePoolPages (NonPagedPool,
984  (PoolTrackTableSize + 1) *
985  sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE));
986 
987  if (PoolTrackTable != NULL) {
988  break;
989  }
990 
991  if (PoolTrackTableSize == 1) {
992  KeBugCheckEx (MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY,
993  NumberOfBytes,
994  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
995  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
996  (ULONG_PTR)-1);
997  }
998 
999  PoolTrackTableSize >>= 1;
1000 
1001  } while (TRUE);
1002 
1003  PoolTrackTableSize += 1;
1004  PoolTrackTableMask = PoolTrackTableSize - 2;
1005 
1006 #if !defined (NT_UP)
1007  ExPoolTagTables[0] = PoolTrackTable;
1008 #endif
1009 
1010  RtlZeroMemory (PoolTrackTable,
1011  PoolTrackTableSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE));
1012 
1013  ExpSeedHotTags ();
1014 
1015  //
1016  // Initialize the large allocation tag table.
1017  //
1018 
1019  NumberOfBytes = PoolBigPageTableSize;
1020  if (NumberOfBytes > MmSizeOfNonPagedPoolInBytes >> 8) {
1021  NumberOfBytes = MmSizeOfNonPagedPoolInBytes >> 8;
1022  }
1023 
1024  for (i = 0; i < 32; i += 1) {
1025  if (NumberOfBytes & 0x1) {
1026  ASSERT ((NumberOfBytes & ~0x1) == 0);
1027  if ((NumberOfBytes & ~0x1) == 0) {
1028  break;
1029  }
1030  }
1031  NumberOfBytes >>= 1;
1032  }
1033 
1034  if (i == 32) {
1035  PoolBigPageTableSize = DEFAULT_BIGPAGE_TABLE;
1036  }
1037  else {
1038  PoolBigPageTableSize = ((SIZE_T)1) << i;
1039  if (PoolBigPageTableSize < 64) {
1040  PoolBigPageTableSize = 64;
1041  }
1042  }
1043 
1044  do {
1045  if (PoolBigPageTableSize > (MAXULONG_PTR / sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES))) {
1046  PoolBigPageTableSize >>= 1;
1047  continue;
1048  }
1049 
1050  PoolBigPageTable = MiAllocatePoolPages (NonPagedPool,
1051  PoolBigPageTableSize *
1052  sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES));
1053 
1054  if (PoolBigPageTable != NULL) {
1055  break;
1056  }
1057 
1058  if (PoolBigPageTableSize == 1) {
1059  KeBugCheckEx (MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY,
1060  NumberOfBytes,
1061  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1062  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1063  (ULONG_PTR)-1);
1064  }
1065 
1066  PoolBigPageTableSize >>= 1;
1067 
1068  } while (TRUE);
1069 
1070  PoolBigPageTableHash = PoolBigPageTableSize - 1;
1071 
1072  RtlZeroMemory (PoolBigPageTable,
1073  PoolBigPageTableSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES));
1074 
1075  p = &PoolBigPageTable[0];
1076  for (i = 0; i < PoolBigPageTableSize; i += 1, p += 1) {
1077  p->Va = (PVOID) POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE;
1078  }
1079 
1080  ExpInsertPoolTracker ('looP',
1081  ROUND_TO_PAGES(PoolBigPageTableSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES)),
1082  NonPagedPool);
1083 
1084  if (KeNumberNodes > 1) {
1085 
1086  ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools = KeNumberNodes;
1087 
1088  //
1089  // Limit the number of pools to the number of bits in the PoolIndex.
1090  //
1091 
1092  if (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 127) {
1093  ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools = 127;
1094  }
1095 
1096  //
1097  // Further limit the number of pools by our array of pointers.
1098  //
1099 
1100  if (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > EXP_MAXIMUM_POOL_NODES) {
1101  ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools = EXP_MAXIMUM_POOL_NODES;
1102  }
1103 
1104  NumberOfBytes = sizeof(POOL_DESCRIPTOR) + sizeof(KLOCK_QUEUE_HANDLE);
1105 
1106  for (Index = 0; Index < ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools; Index += 1) {
1107 
1108  //
1109  // Here's a thorny problem. We'd like to use
1110  // MmAllocateIndependentPages but can't because we'd need
1111  // system PTEs to map the pages with and PTEs are not
1112  // available until nonpaged pool exists. So just use
1113  // regular pool pages to hold the descriptors and spinlocks
1114  // and hope they either a) happen to fall onto the right node
1115  // or b) that these lines live in the local processor cache
1116  // all the time anyway due to frequent usage.
1117  //
1118 
1119  Descriptor = (PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR) MiAllocatePoolPages (
1120  NonPagedPool,
1121  NumberOfBytes);
1122 
1123  if (Descriptor == NULL) {
1124  KeBugCheckEx (MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY,
1125  NumberOfBytes,
1126  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1127  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1128  (ULONG_PTR)-1);
1129  }
1130 
1131  ExpNonPagedPoolDescriptor[Index] = Descriptor;
1132 
1133  SpinLock = (PKSPIN_LOCK)(Descriptor + 1);
1134 
1135  KeInitializeSpinLock (SpinLock);
1136 
1137  ExInitializePoolDescriptor (Descriptor,
1138  NonPagedPool,
1139  Index,
1140  Threshold,
1141  (PVOID)SpinLock);
1142  }
1143  }
1144 
1145  //
1146  // Initialize the spinlocks for nonpaged pool.
1147  //
1148 
1149  KeInitializeSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock);
1150 
1151  //
1152  // Initialize the nonpaged pool descriptor.
1153  //
1154 
1155  PoolVector[NonPagedPool] = &NonPagedPoolDescriptor;
1156  ExInitializePoolDescriptor (&NonPagedPoolDescriptor,
1157  NonPagedPool,
1158  0,
1159  Threshold,
1160  NULL);
1161  }
1162  else {
1163 
1164  //
1165  // Allocate memory for the paged pool descriptors and fast mutexes.
1166  //
1167 
1168  if (KeNumberNodes > 1) {
1169 
1170  ExpNumberOfPagedPools = KeNumberNodes;
1171 
1172  //
1173  // Limit the number of pools to the number of bits in the PoolIndex.
1174  //
1175 
1176  if (ExpNumberOfPagedPools > 127) {
1177  ExpNumberOfPagedPools = 127;
1178  }
1179  }
1180 
1181  //
1182  // Further limit the number of pools by our array of pointers.
1183  //
1184 
1185  if (ExpNumberOfPagedPools > EXP_MAXIMUM_POOL_NODES) {
1186  ExpNumberOfPagedPools = EXP_MAXIMUM_POOL_NODES;
1187  }
1188 
1189  //
1190  // For NUMA systems, allocate both the pool descriptor and the
1191  // associated lock from the local node for performance (even though
1192  // it costs a little more memory).
1193  //
1194  // For non-NUMA systems, allocate everything together in one chunk
1195  // to reduce memory consumption as there is no performance cost
1196  // for doing it this way.
1197  //
1198 
1199  if (KeNumberNodes > 1) {
1200 
1201  NumberOfBytes = sizeof(KGUARDED_MUTEX) + sizeof(POOL_DESCRIPTOR);
1202 
1203  for (Index = 0; Index < ExpNumberOfPagedPools + 1; Index += 1) {
1204 
1205  ULONG Node;
1206 
1207  if (Index == 0) {
1208  Node = 0;
1209  }
1210  else {
1211  Node = Index - 1;
1212  }
1213 
1214  Descriptor = (PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR) MmAllocateIndependentPages (
1215  NumberOfBytes,
1216  Node);
1217  if (Descriptor == NULL) {
1218  KeBugCheckEx (MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY,
1219  NumberOfBytes,
1220  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1221  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1222  (ULONG_PTR)-1);
1223  }
1224  ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[Index] = Descriptor;
1225 
1226  GuardedMutex = (PKGUARDED_MUTEX)(Descriptor + 1);
1227 
1228  if (Index == 0) {
1229  PoolVector[PagedPool] = Descriptor;
1230  ExpPagedPoolMutex = GuardedMutex;
1231  }
1232 
1233  KeInitializeGuardedMutex (GuardedMutex);
1234 
1235  ExInitializePoolDescriptor (Descriptor,
1236  PagedPool,
1237  Index,
1238  Threshold,
1239  (PVOID) GuardedMutex);
1240  }
1241  }
1242  else {
1243 
1244  NumberOfBytes = (ExpNumberOfPagedPools + 1) * (sizeof(KGUARDED_MUTEX) + sizeof(POOL_DESCRIPTOR));
1245 
1246  Descriptor = (PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR)ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
1247  NumberOfBytes,
1248  'looP');
1249  if (Descriptor == NULL) {
1250  KeBugCheckEx (MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY,
1251  NumberOfBytes,
1252  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1253  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
1254  (ULONG_PTR)-1);
1255  }
1256 
1257  GuardedMutex = (PKGUARDED_MUTEX)(Descriptor + ExpNumberOfPagedPools + 1);
1258 
1259  PoolVector[PagedPool] = Descriptor;
1260  ExpPagedPoolMutex = GuardedMutex;
1261 
1262  for (Index = 0; Index < ExpNumberOfPagedPools + 1; Index += 1) {
1263  KeInitializeGuardedMutex (GuardedMutex);
1264  ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[Index] = Descriptor;
1265  ExInitializePoolDescriptor (Descriptor,
1266  PagedPool,
1267  Index,
1268  Threshold,
1269  (PVOID) GuardedMutex);
1270 
1271  Descriptor += 1;
1272  GuardedMutex += 1;
1273  }
1274  }
1275 
1276  ExpInsertPoolTracker('looP',
1277  ROUND_TO_PAGES(PoolTrackTableSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE)),
1278  NonPagedPool);
1279 
1280 #if defined (NT_UP)
1281  if (MmNumberOfPhysicalPages < 32 * 1024) {
1282 
1283  LARGE_INTEGER TwoMinutes;
1284 
1285  //
1286  // Set the flag to disable lookasides and use hot/cold page
1287  // separation during bootup.
1288  //
1289 
1290  ExSetPoolFlags (EX_SEPARATE_HOT_PAGES_DURING_BOOT);
1291 
1292  //
1293  // Start a timer so the above behavior is disabled once bootup
1294  // has finished.
1295  //
1296 
1297  KeInitializeTimer (&ExpBootFinishedTimer);
1298 
1299  KeInitializeDpc (&ExpBootFinishedTimerDpc,
1300  (PKDEFERRED_ROUTINE) ExpBootFinishedDispatch,
1301  NULL);
1302 
1303  TwoMinutes.QuadPart = Int32x32To64 (120, -10000000);
1304 
1305  KeSetTimer (&ExpBootFinishedTimer,
1306  TwoMinutes,
1307  &ExpBootFinishedTimerDpc);
1308  }
1309 #endif
1310  if ((MmNumberOfPhysicalPages >= 127 * 1024) &&
1311  ((ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) == 0) &&
1312  (!NT_SUCCESS (MmIsVerifierEnabled (&i)))) {
1313 
1314  ExSetPoolFlags (EX_DELAY_POOL_FREES);
1315  }
1316 
1317  if ((ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) ||
1318  (NT_SUCCESS (MmIsVerifierEnabled (&i)))) {
1319 
1320 #if DBG
1321 
1322  //
1323  // Ensure ExFreePoolMask is a power of 2 minus 1 (or zero).
1324  //
1325 
1326  if (ExFreePoolMask != 0) {
1327 
1328  NumberOfBytes = ExFreePoolMask + 1;
1329  ASSERT (NumberOfBytes != 0);
1330 
1331  for (i = 0; i < 32; i += 1) {
1332  if (NumberOfBytes & 0x1) {
1333  ASSERT ((NumberOfBytes & ~0x1) == 0);
1334  break;
1335  }
1336  NumberOfBytes >>= 1;
1337  }
1338  }
1339 
1340 #endif
1341 
1342  ExFreePoolTraces = MiAllocatePoolPages (NonPagedPool,
1343  (ExFreePoolMask + 1) *
1344  sizeof (EX_FREE_POOL_TRACES));
1345 
1346  if (ExFreePoolTraces != NULL) {
1347  RtlZeroMemory (ExFreePoolTraces,
1348  (ExFreePoolMask + 1) * sizeof (EX_FREE_POOL_TRACES));
1349  }
1350  }
1351  }
1352 }
1353 
1354 #if DBG
1355 ULONG ExStopBadTags;
1356 #endif
1357 
1358 
1359 FORCEINLINE
1360 VOID
1361 ExpInsertPoolTrackerInline (
1362  IN ULONG Key,
1363  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
1364  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType
1365  )
1366 
1367 /*++
1368 
1369 Routine Description:
1370 
1371  This function inserts a pool tag in the tag table, increments the
1372  number of allocates and updates the total allocation size.
1373 
1374 Arguments:
1375 
1376  Key - Supplies the key value used to locate a matching entry in the
1377  tag table.
1378 
1379  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the allocation size.
1380 
1381  PoolType - Supplies the pool type.
1382 
1383 Return Value:
1384 
1385  None.
1386 
1387 Environment:
1388 
1389  No pool locks held except during the rare case of expansion table growth.
1390  so pool may be freely allocated here as needed. In expansion table growth,
1391  the tagged spinlock is held on entry, but we are guaranteed to find an
1392  entry in the builtin table so a recursive acquire cannot occur.
1393 
1394 --*/
1395 
1396 {
1397  ULONG Hash;
1398  ULONG Index;
1399  LONG OriginalKey;
1400  KIRQL OldIrql;
1401  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackTable;
1402  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackTableEntry;
1403  SIZE_T TrackTableMask;
1404  SIZE_T TrackTableSize;
1405 #if !defined (NT_UP)
1406  ULONG Processor;
1407 #endif
1408 
1409  //
1410  // Strip the protected pool bit.
1411  //
1412 
1413  Key &= ~PROTECTED_POOL;
1414 
1415  if (Key == PoolHitTag) {
1416  DbgBreakPoint();
1417  }
1418 
1419 #if DBG
1420  if (ExStopBadTags) {
1421  ASSERT (Key & 0xFFFFFF00);
1422  }
1423 #endif
1424 
1425  //
1426  // Compute the hash index and search (lock-free) for the pool tag
1427  // in the builtin table.
1428  //
1429 
1430  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
1431  TrackTable = ExpSessionPoolTrackTable;
1432  TrackTableMask = ExpSessionPoolTrackTableMask;
1433  TrackTableSize = ExpSessionPoolTrackTableSize;
1434  }
1435  else {
1436 
1437 #if !defined (NT_UP)
1438 
1439  //
1440  // Use the current processor to pick a pool tag table to use. Note that
1441  // in rare cases, this thread may context switch to another processor
1442  // but the algorithms below will still be correct.
1443  //
1444 
1445  Processor = KeGetCurrentProcessorNumber ();
1446 
1447  ASSERT (Processor < MAXIMUM_PROCESSOR_TAG_TABLES);
1448 
1449  TrackTable = ExPoolTagTables[Processor];
1450 
1451 #else
1452 
1453  TrackTable = PoolTrackTable;
1454 
1455 #endif
1456 
1457  TrackTableMask = PoolTrackTableMask;
1458  TrackTableSize = PoolTrackTableSize;
1459  }
1460 
1461  Hash = POOLTAG_HASH (Key, TrackTableMask);
1462 
1463  Index = Hash;
1464 
1465  do {
1466 
1467  TrackTableEntry = &TrackTable[Hash];
1468 
1469  if (TrackTableEntry->Key == Key) {
1470 
1471  //
1472  // Update the fields with interlocked operations as other
1473  // threads may also have begun doing so by this point.
1474  //
1475 
1476  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
1477  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &TrackTableEntry->PagedAllocs);
1478  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&TrackTableEntry->PagedBytes,
1479  NumberOfBytes);
1480  }
1481  else {
1482  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &TrackTableEntry->NonPagedAllocs);
1483  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&TrackTableEntry->NonPagedBytes,
1484  NumberOfBytes);
1485 
1486  }
1487 
1488  return;
1489  }
1490 
1491  if (TrackTableEntry->Key == 0) {
1492 
1493  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
1494 
1495  if (Hash == TrackTableSize - 1) {
1496  Hash = 0;
1497  if (Hash == Index) {
1498  break;
1499  }
1500  }
1501  else {
1502 
1503  OriginalKey = InterlockedCompareExchange ((PLONG)&TrackTable[Hash].Key,
1504  (LONG)Key,
1505  0);
1506  }
1507 
1508  //
1509  // Either this thread has won the race and the requested tag
1510  // is now in or some other thread won the race and took this
1511  // slot (using this tag or a different one).
1512  //
1513  // Just fall through to common checks starting at this slot
1514  // for both cases.
1515  //
1516 
1517  continue;
1518  }
1519 
1520 #if !defined (NT_UP)
1521 
1522  if (PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key != 0) {
1523  TrackTableEntry->Key = PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key;
1524  continue;
1525  }
1526 
1527 #endif
1528 
1529  if (Hash != PoolTrackTableSize - 1) {
1530 
1531  //
1532  // New entries cannot be created with an interlocked compare
1533  // exchange because any new entry must reside at the same index
1534  // in each processor's private PoolTrackTable. This is to make
1535  // ExGetPoolTagInfo statistics gathering much simpler (faster).
1536  //
1537 
1538  ExAcquireSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, &OldIrql);
1539 
1540  if (PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key == 0) {
1541 
1542  ASSERT (TrackTable[Hash].Key == 0);
1543 
1544  PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key = Key;
1545  TrackTableEntry->Key = Key;
1546  }
1547 
1548  ExReleaseSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, OldIrql);
1549 
1550  //
1551  // Either this thread has won the race and the requested tag
1552  // is now in or some other thread won the race and took this
1553  // slot (using this tag or a different one).
1554  //
1555  // Just fall through to common checks starting at this slot
1556  // for both cases.
1557  //
1558 
1559  continue;
1560  }
1561  }
1562 
1563  Hash = (Hash + 1) & (ULONG)TrackTableMask;
1564 
1565  if (Hash == Index) {
1566  break;
1567  }
1568 
1569  } while (TRUE);
1570 
1571  //
1572  // No matching entry and no free entry was found.
1573  //
1574  // Use the expansion table instead.
1575  //
1576 
1577  ExpInsertPoolTrackerExpansion (Key, NumberOfBytes, PoolType);
1578 }
1579 
1580 FORCEINLINE
1581 VOID
1582 ExpRemovePoolTrackerInline (
1583  IN ULONG Key,
1584  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
1585  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType
1586  )
1587 
1588 /*++
1589 
1590 Routine Description:
1591 
1592  This function increments the number of frees and updates the total
1593  allocation size.
1594 
1595 Arguments:
1596 
1597  Key - Supplies the key value used to locate a matching entry in the
1598  tag table.
1599 
1600  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the allocation size.
1601 
1602  PoolType - Supplies the pool type.
1603 
1604 Return Value:
1605 
1606  None.
1607 
1608 --*/
1609 
1610 {
1611  ULONG Hash;
1612  ULONG Index;
1613  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackTable;
1614  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackTableEntry;
1615  SIZE_T TrackTableMask;
1616  SIZE_T TrackTableSize;
1617 #if !defined (NT_UP)
1618  ULONG Processor;
1619 #endif
1620 
1621  //
1622  // Strip protected pool bit.
1623  //
1624 
1625  Key &= ~PROTECTED_POOL;
1626  if (Key == PoolHitTag) {
1627  DbgBreakPoint ();
1628  }
1629 
1630  //
1631  // Compute the hash index and search (lock-free) for the pool tag
1632  // in the builtin table.
1633  //
1634 
1635  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
1636  TrackTable = ExpSessionPoolTrackTable;
1637  TrackTableMask = ExpSessionPoolTrackTableMask;
1638  TrackTableSize = ExpSessionPoolTrackTableSize;
1639  }
1640  else {
1641 
1642 #if !defined (NT_UP)
1643 
1644  //
1645  // Use the current processor to pick a pool tag table to use. Note that
1646  // in rare cases, this thread may context switch to another processor
1647  // but the algorithms below will still be correct.
1648  //
1649 
1650  Processor = KeGetCurrentProcessorNumber ();
1651 
1652  ASSERT (Processor < MAXIMUM_PROCESSOR_TAG_TABLES);
1653 
1654  TrackTable = ExPoolTagTables[Processor];
1655 
1656 #else
1657 
1658  TrackTable = PoolTrackTable;
1659 
1660 #endif
1661 
1662  TrackTableMask = PoolTrackTableMask;
1663  TrackTableSize = PoolTrackTableSize;
1664  }
1665 
1666  Hash = POOLTAG_HASH (Key, TrackTableMask);
1667 
1668  Index = Hash;
1669 
1670  do {
1671  TrackTableEntry = &TrackTable[Hash];
1672 
1673  if (TrackTableEntry->Key == Key) {
1674 
1675  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
1676  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &TrackTableEntry->PagedFrees);
1677  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&TrackTableEntry->PagedBytes,
1678  0 - NumberOfBytes);
1679  }
1680  else {
1681  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &TrackTableEntry->NonPagedFrees);
1682  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&TrackTableEntry->NonPagedBytes,
1683  0 - NumberOfBytes);
1684  }
1685  return;
1686  }
1687 
1688  //
1689  // Since each processor's table is lazy updated, handle the case
1690  // here where this processor's table still has no entry for the tag
1691  // being freed because the allocation happened on a different
1692  // processor.
1693  //
1694 
1695  if (TrackTableEntry->Key == 0) {
1696 
1697 #if !defined (NT_UP)
1698 
1699  if (((PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) == 0) &&
1700  (PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key != 0)) {
1701 
1702  TrackTableEntry->Key = PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key;
1703  continue;
1704  }
1705 
1706 #endif
1707 
1708  ASSERT (Hash == TrackTableMask);
1709  }
1710 
1711  Hash = (Hash + 1) & (ULONG)TrackTableMask;
1712 
1713  if (Hash == Index) {
1714  break;
1715  }
1716 
1717  } while (TRUE);
1718 
1719  //
1720  // No matching entry and no free entry was found.
1721  //
1722  // Linear search through the expansion table. This is ok because
1723  // the existence of an expansion table at all is extremely rare.
1724  //
1725 
1726  ExpRemovePoolTrackerExpansion (Key, NumberOfBytes, PoolType);
1727 }
1728 PVOID
1729 VeAllocatePoolWithTagPriority (
1730  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType,
1731  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
1732  IN ULONG Tag,
1733  IN EX_POOL_PRIORITY Priority,
1734  IN PVOID CallingAddress
1735  );
1736 
1737 
1738 __bcount(NumberOfBytes)
1739 PVOID
1740 ExAllocatePoolWithTag (
1741  __in POOL_TYPE PoolType,
1742  __in SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
1743  __in ULONG Tag
1744  )
1745 
1746 /*++
1747 
1748 Routine Description:
1749 
1750  This function allocates a block of pool of the specified type and
1751  returns a pointer to the allocated block. This function is used to
1752  access both the page-aligned pools and the list head entries (less
1753  than a page) pools.
1754 
1755  If the number of bytes specifies a size that is too large to be
1756  satisfied by the appropriate list, then the page-aligned pool
1757  allocator is used. The allocated block will be page-aligned and a
1758  page-sized multiple.
1759 
1760  Otherwise, the appropriate pool list entry is used. The allocated
1761  block will be 64-bit aligned, but will not be page aligned. The
1762  pool allocator calculates the smallest number of POOL_BLOCK_SIZE
1763  that can be used to satisfy the request. If there are no blocks
1764  available of this size, then a block of the next larger block size
1765  is allocated and split. One piece is placed back into the pool, and
1766  the other piece is used to satisfy the request. If the allocator
1767  reaches the paged-sized block list, and nothing is there, the
1768  page-aligned pool allocator is called. The page is split and added
1769  to the pool.
1770 
1771 Arguments:
1772 
1773  PoolType - Supplies the type of pool to allocate. If the pool type
1774  is one of the "MustSucceed" pool types, then this call will
1775  succeed and return a pointer to allocated pool or bugcheck on failure.
1776  For all other cases, if the system cannot allocate the requested amount
1777  of memory, NULL is returned.
1778 
1779  Valid pool types:
1780 
1781  NonPagedPool
1782  PagedPool
1783  NonPagedPoolMustSucceed,
1784  NonPagedPoolCacheAligned
1785  PagedPoolCacheAligned
1786  NonPagedPoolCacheAlignedMustSucceed
1787 
1788  Tag - Supplies the caller's identifying tag.
1789 
1790  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the number of bytes to allocate.
1791 
1792 Return Value:
1793 
1794  NULL - The PoolType is not one of the "MustSucceed" pool types, and
1795  not enough pool exists to satisfy the request.
1796 
1797  NON-NULL - Returns a pointer to the allocated pool.
1798 
1799 --*/
1800 
1801 {
1802  PKGUARDED_MUTEX Lock;
1803  PVOID Block;
1804  PPOOL_HEADER Entry;
1805  PGENERAL_LOOKASIDE LookasideList;
1806  PPOOL_HEADER NextEntry;
1807  PPOOL_HEADER SplitEntry;
1808  KLOCK_QUEUE_HANDLE LockHandle;
1809  PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR PoolDesc;
1810  ULONG Index;
1811  ULONG ListNumber;
1812  ULONG NeededSize;
1813  ULONG PoolIndex;
1814  POOL_TYPE CheckType;
1815  POOL_TYPE RequestType;
1816  PLIST_ENTRY ListHead;
1817  POOL_TYPE NewPoolType;
1818  PKPRCB Prcb;
1819  ULONG NumberOfPages;
1820  ULONG RetryCount;
1821  PVOID CallingAddress;
1822 #if defined (_X86_)
1823  PVOID CallersCaller;
1824 #endif
1825 
1826 #define CacheOverhead POOL_OVERHEAD
1827 
1828  PERFINFO_EXALLOCATEPOOLWITHTAG_DECL();
1829 
1830  ASSERT (Tag != 0);
1831  ASSERT (Tag != ' GIB');
1832  ASSERT (NumberOfBytes != 0);
1833  ASSERT_ALLOCATE_IRQL (PoolType, NumberOfBytes);
1834 
1835  if (ExpPoolFlags & (EX_KERNEL_VERIFIER_ENABLED | EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED)) {
1836 
1837  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_KERNEL_VERIFIER_ENABLED) {
1838 
1839  if ((PoolType & POOL_DRIVER_MASK) == 0) {
1840 
1841  //
1842  // Use the Driver Verifier pool framework. Note this will
1843  // result in a recursive callback to this routine.
1844  //
1845 
1846 #if defined (_X86_)
1847  RtlGetCallersAddress (&CallingAddress, &CallersCaller);
1848 #else
1849  CallingAddress = (PVOID)_ReturnAddress();
1850 #endif
1851 
1852  return VeAllocatePoolWithTagPriority (PoolType | POOL_DRIVER_MASK,
1853  NumberOfBytes,
1854  Tag,
1855  HighPoolPriority,
1856  CallingAddress);
1857  }
1858  PoolType &= ~POOL_DRIVER_MASK;
1859  }
1860 
1861  //
1862  // Use special pool if there is a tag or size match.
1863  //
1864 
1865  if ((ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) &&
1866  (MmUseSpecialPool (NumberOfBytes, Tag))) {
1867 
1868  Entry = MmAllocateSpecialPool (NumberOfBytes,
1869  Tag,
1870  PoolType,
1871  2);
1872  if (Entry != NULL) {
1873  return (PVOID)Entry;
1874  }
1875  }
1876  }
1877 
1878  //
1879  // Isolate the base pool type and select a pool from which to allocate
1880  // the specified block size.
1881  //
1882 
1883  CheckType = PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK;
1884 
1885  if ((PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) == 0) {
1886  PoolDesc = PoolVector[CheckType];
1887  }
1888  else {
1889  PoolDesc = ExpSessionPoolDescriptor;
1890  }
1891 
1892  ASSERT (PoolDesc != NULL);
1893 
1894  //
1895  // Initializing LockHandle is not needed for correctness but without
1896  // it the compiler cannot compile this code W4 to check for use of
1897  // uninitialized variables.
1898  //
1899 
1900  LockHandle.OldIrql = 0;
1901 
1902  //
1903  // Check to determine if the requested block can be allocated from one
1904  // of the pool lists or must be directly allocated from virtual memory.
1905  //
1906 
1907  if (NumberOfBytes > POOL_BUDDY_MAX) {
1908 
1909  //
1910  // The requested size is greater than the largest block maintained
1911  // by allocation lists.
1912  //
1913 
1914  RequestType = (PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK | POOL_VERIFIER_MASK));
1915 
1916  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER) MiAllocatePoolPages (RequestType,
1917  NumberOfBytes);
1918 
1919  if (Entry == NULL) {
1920 
1921  //
1922  // If there are deferred free blocks, free them now and retry.
1923  //
1924 
1925  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_DELAY_POOL_FREES) {
1926 
1927  ExDeferredFreePool (PoolDesc);
1928 
1929  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER) MiAllocatePoolPages (RequestType,
1930  NumberOfBytes);
1931  }
1932  }
1933 
1934  if (Entry == NULL) {
1935 
1936  if (PoolType & MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_TYPE_MASK) {
1937  KeBugCheckEx (MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY,
1938  NumberOfBytes,
1939  NonPagedPoolDescriptor.TotalPages,
1940  NonPagedPoolDescriptor.TotalBigPages,
1941  0);
1942  }
1943 
1944  ExPoolFailures += 1;
1945 
1946  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_PRINT_POOL_FAILURES) {
1947  KdPrint(("EX: ExAllocatePool (%p, 0x%x) returning NULL\n",
1948  NumberOfBytes,
1949  PoolType));
1950  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_STOP_ON_POOL_FAILURES) {
1951  DbgBreakPoint ();
1952  }
1953  }
1954 
1955  if ((PoolType & POOL_RAISE_IF_ALLOCATION_FAILURE) != 0) {
1956  ExRaiseStatus (STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES);
1957  }
1958 
1959  return NULL;
1960  }
1961 
1962  NumberOfPages = (ULONG) BYTES_TO_PAGES (NumberOfBytes);
1963 
1964  InterlockedExchangeAdd ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->TotalBigPages,
1965  (LONG)NumberOfPages);
1966 
1967  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolDesc->TotalBytes,
1968  (SIZE_T)NumberOfPages << PAGE_SHIFT);
1969 
1970  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->RunningAllocs);
1971 
1972  //
1973  // Mark the allocation as session-based so that when it is freed
1974  // we can detect that the session pool descriptor is the one to
1975  // be credited (not the global nonpaged descriptor).
1976  //
1977 
1978  if ((PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) && (CheckType == NonPagedPool)) {
1979  MiMarkPoolLargeSession (Entry);
1980  }
1981 
1982  //
1983  // Note nonpaged session allocations get turned into global
1984  // session allocations internally, so they must be added to the
1985  // global tag tables. Paged session allocations go into their
1986  // own tables.
1987  //
1988 
1989  if (ExpAddTagForBigPages ((PVOID)Entry,
1990  Tag,
1991  NumberOfPages,
1992  PoolType) == FALSE) {
1993 
1994  //
1995  // Note that not being able to add the tag entry above
1996  // implies 2 things: The allocation must now be tagged
1997  // as BIG because the subsequent free also won't find it
1998  // in the big page tag table and so it must use BIG when
1999  // removing it from the PoolTrackTable. Also that the free
2000  // must get the size from MiFreePoolPages since the
2001  // big page tag table won't have the size in this case.
2002  //
2003 
2004  Tag = ' GIB';
2005  }
2006 
2007  ExpInsertPoolTracker (Tag,
2008  ROUND_TO_PAGES(NumberOfBytes),
2009  PoolType);
2010 
2011  PERFINFO_BIGPOOLALLOC (PoolType, Tag, NumberOfBytes, Entry);
2012 
2013  return Entry;
2014  }
2015 
2016  if (NumberOfBytes == 0) {
2017 
2018  //
2019  // Besides fragmenting pool, zero byte requests would not be handled
2020  // in cases where the minimum pool block size is the same as the
2021  // pool header size (no room for flink/blinks, etc).
2022  //
2023 
2024 #if DBG
2025  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER, 0, 0, PoolType, Tag);
2026 #else
2027  NumberOfBytes = 1;
2028 #endif
2029  }
2030 
2031  //
2032  // The requested size is less than or equal to the size of the
2033  // maximum block maintained by the allocation lists.
2034  //
2035 
2036  PERFINFO_POOLALLOC (PoolType, Tag, NumberOfBytes);
2037 
2038  //
2039  // Compute the index of the listhead for blocks of the requested size.
2040  //
2041 
2042  ListNumber = (ULONG)((NumberOfBytes + POOL_OVERHEAD + (POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK - 1)) >> POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT);
2043 
2044  NeededSize = ListNumber;
2045 
2046  if (CheckType == PagedPool) {
2047 
2048  //
2049  // If the requested pool block is a small block, then attempt to
2050  // allocate the requested pool from the per processor lookaside
2051  // list. If the attempt fails, then attempt to allocate from the
2052  // system lookaside list. If the attempt fails, then select a
2053  // pool to allocate from and allocate the block normally.
2054  //
2055  // Also note that if hot/cold separation is enabled, allocations are
2056  // not satisfied from lookaside lists as these are either :
2057  //
2058  // 1. cold references
2059  //
2060  // or
2061  //
2062  // 2. we are still booting on a small machine, thus keeping pool
2063  // locality dense (to reduce the working set footprint thereby
2064  // reducing page stealing) is a bigger win in terms of overall
2065  // speed than trying to satisfy individual requests more quickly.
2066  //
2067 
2068  if ((PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) == 0) {
2069 
2070  //
2071  // Check for prototype pool - always allocate it from its own
2072  // pages as the sharecounts applied on these allocations by
2073  // memory management make it more difficult to trim these pages.
2074  // This is an optimization so that other pageable allocation pages
2075  // (which are much easier to trim because their sharecount is
2076  // almost always only 1) don't end up being mostly resident because
2077  // of a single prototype pool allocation within in. Note this
2078  // also makes it easier to remove specific pages for hot remove
2079  // or callers that need contiguous physical memory.
2080  //
2081 
2082  if (PoolType & POOL_MM_ALLOCATION) {
2083  PoolIndex = 0;
2084  ASSERT (PoolDesc->PoolIndex == 0);
2085  goto restart1;
2086  }
2087 
2088  if ((NeededSize <= POOL_SMALL_LISTS) &&
2089  (USING_HOT_COLD_METRICS == 0)) {
2090 
2091  Prcb = KeGetCurrentPrcb ();
2092  LookasideList = Prcb->PPPagedLookasideList[NeededSize - 1].P;
2093  LookasideList->TotalAllocates += 1;
2094 
2095  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)
2096  InterlockedPopEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead);
2097 
2098  if (Entry == NULL) {
2099  LookasideList = Prcb->PPPagedLookasideList[NeededSize - 1].L;
2100  LookasideList->TotalAllocates += 1;
2101 
2102  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)
2103  InterlockedPopEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead);
2104  }
2105 
2106  if (Entry != NULL) {
2107 
2108  Entry -= 1;
2109  LookasideList->AllocateHits += 1;
2110  NewPoolType = (PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | POOL_QUOTA_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK | POOL_VERIFIER_MASK)) + 1;
2111  NewPoolType |= POOL_IN_USE_MASK;
2112 
2113  Entry->PoolType = (UCHAR)NewPoolType;
2114 
2115  Entry->PoolTag = Tag;
2116 
2117  ExpInsertPoolTrackerInline (Tag,
2118  Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT,
2119  PoolType);
2120 
2121  //
2122  // Zero out any back pointer to our internal structures
2123  // to stop someone from corrupting us via an
2124  // uninitialized pointer.
2125  //
2126 
2127  ((PULONG_PTR)((PCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead))[0] = 0;
2128 
2129  PERFINFO_POOLALLOC_ADDR((PUCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead);
2130 
2131  return (PUCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead;
2132  }
2133  }
2134 
2135  //
2136  // If there is more than one paged pool, then attempt to find
2137  // one that can be immediately locked.
2138  //
2139  //
2140  // N.B. The paged pool is selected in a round robin fashion using a
2141  // simple counter. Note that the counter is incremented using
2142  // a a noninterlocked sequence, but the pool index is never
2143  // allowed to get out of range.
2144  //
2145 
2146  if (USING_HOT_COLD_METRICS) {
2147 
2148  if ((PoolType & POOL_COLD_ALLOCATION) == 0) {
2149 
2150  //
2151  // Hot allocations come from the first paged pool.
2152  //
2153 
2154  PoolIndex = 1;
2155  }
2156  else {
2157 
2158  //
2159  // Force cold allocations to come from
2160  // the last paged pool.
2161  //
2162 
2163  PoolIndex = ExpNumberOfPagedPools;
2164  }
2165  }
2166  else {
2167 
2168  if (KeNumberNodes > 1) {
2169 
2170  //
2171  // Use the pool descriptor which contains memory
2172  // local to the current processor even if we have to
2173  // wait for it. While it is possible that the
2174  // paged pool addresses in the local descriptor
2175  // have been paged out, on large memory
2176  // NUMA machines this should be less common.
2177  //
2178 
2179  Prcb = KeGetCurrentPrcb ();
2180 
2181  PoolIndex = Prcb->ParentNode->Color;
2182 
2183  if (PoolIndex < ExpNumberOfPagedPools) {
2184  PoolIndex += 1;
2185  PoolDesc = ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[PoolIndex];
2186  RequestType = PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK);
2187  RetryCount = 0;
2188  goto restart2;
2189  }
2190  }
2191 
2192  PoolIndex = 1;
2193  if (ExpNumberOfPagedPools != PoolIndex) {
2194  ExpPoolIndex += 1;
2195  PoolIndex = ExpPoolIndex;
2196  if (PoolIndex > ExpNumberOfPagedPools) {
2197  PoolIndex = 1;
2198  ExpPoolIndex = 1;
2199  }
2200 
2201  Index = PoolIndex;
2202  do {
2203  Lock = (PKGUARDED_MUTEX) ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[PoolIndex]->LockAddress;
2204 
2205  if (KeGetOwnerGuardedMutex (Lock) == NULL) {
2206  break;
2207  }
2208 
2209  PoolIndex += 1;
2210  if (PoolIndex > ExpNumberOfPagedPools) {
2211  PoolIndex = 1;
2212  }
2213 
2214  } while (PoolIndex != Index);
2215  }
2216  }
2217 
2218  PoolDesc = ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[PoolIndex];
2219  }
2220  else {
2221 
2222  if (NeededSize <= ExpSessionPoolSmallLists) {
2223 
2224  LookasideList = (PGENERAL_LOOKASIDE)(ULONG_PTR)(ExpSessionPoolLookaside + NeededSize - 1);
2225  LookasideList->TotalAllocates += 1;
2226 
2227  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)
2228  InterlockedPopEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead);
2229 
2230  if (Entry != NULL) {
2231 
2232  Entry -= 1;
2233  LookasideList->AllocateHits += 1;
2234  NewPoolType = (PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | POOL_QUOTA_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK | POOL_VERIFIER_MASK)) + 1;
2235  NewPoolType |= POOL_IN_USE_MASK;
2236 
2237  Entry->PoolType = (UCHAR)NewPoolType;
2238 
2239  Entry->PoolTag = Tag;
2240 
2241  ExpInsertPoolTrackerInline (Tag,
2242  Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT,
2243  PoolType);
2244 
2245  //
2246  // Zero out any back pointer to our internal structures
2247  // to stop someone from corrupting us via an
2248  // uninitialized pointer.
2249  //
2250 
2251  ((PULONG_PTR)((PCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead))[0] = 0;
2252 
2253  PERFINFO_POOLALLOC_ADDR((PUCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead);
2254 
2255  return (PUCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead;
2256  }
2257  }
2258 
2259  //
2260  // Only one paged pool is available per session.
2261  //
2262 
2263  PoolIndex = 0;
2264  ASSERT (PoolDesc == ExpSessionPoolDescriptor);
2265  ASSERT (PoolDesc->PoolIndex == 0);
2266  }
2267  }
2268  else {
2269 
2270  //
2271  // If the requested pool block is a small block, then attempt to
2272  // allocate the requested pool from the per processor lookaside
2273  // list. If the attempt fails, then attempt to allocate from the
2274  // system lookaside list. If the attempt fails, then select a
2275  // pool to allocate from and allocate the block normally.
2276  //
2277  // Only session paged pool allocations come from the per session pools.
2278  // Nonpaged session pool allocations still come from global pool.
2279  //
2280 
2281  if (NeededSize <= POOL_SMALL_LISTS) {
2282 
2283  Prcb = KeGetCurrentPrcb ();
2284  LookasideList = Prcb->PPNPagedLookasideList[NeededSize - 1].P;
2285  LookasideList->TotalAllocates += 1;
2286 
2287  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)
2288  InterlockedPopEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead);
2289 
2290  if (Entry == NULL) {
2291  LookasideList = Prcb->PPNPagedLookasideList[NeededSize - 1].L;
2292  LookasideList->TotalAllocates += 1;
2293 
2294  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)
2295  InterlockedPopEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead);
2296  }
2297 
2298  if (Entry != NULL) {
2299 
2300  Entry -= 1;
2301  LookasideList->AllocateHits += 1;
2302  NewPoolType = (PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | POOL_QUOTA_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK | POOL_VERIFIER_MASK)) + 1;
2303  NewPoolType |= POOL_IN_USE_MASK;
2304 
2305  Entry->PoolType = (UCHAR)NewPoolType;
2306 
2307  Entry->PoolTag = Tag;
2308 
2309  ExpInsertPoolTrackerInline (Tag,
2310  Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT,
2311  PoolType);
2312 
2313  //
2314  // Zero out any back pointer to our internal structures
2315  // to stop someone from corrupting us via an
2316  // uninitialized pointer.
2317  //
2318 
2319  ((PULONG_PTR)((PCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead))[0] = 0;
2320 
2321  PERFINFO_POOLALLOC_ADDR((PUCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead);
2322 
2323  return (PUCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead;
2324  }
2325  }
2326 
2327  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
2328  PoolDesc = PoolVector[CheckType];
2329  }
2330 
2331  if (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools <= 1) {
2332  PoolIndex = 0;
2333  }
2334  else {
2335 
2336  //
2337  // Use the pool descriptor which contains memory local to
2338  // the current processor even if we have to contend for its lock.
2339  //
2340 
2341  Prcb = KeGetCurrentPrcb ();
2342 
2343  PoolIndex = Prcb->ParentNode->Color;
2344 
2345  if (PoolIndex >= ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools) {
2346  PoolIndex = ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools - 1;
2347  }
2348 
2349  PoolDesc = ExpNonPagedPoolDescriptor[PoolIndex];
2350  }
2351 
2352  ASSERT(PoolIndex == PoolDesc->PoolIndex);
2353  }
2354 
2355 restart1:
2356 
2357  RequestType = PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK);
2358  RetryCount = 0;
2359 
2360 restart2:
2361 
2362  ListHead = &PoolDesc->ListHeads[ListNumber];
2363 
2364  //
2365  // Walk the listheads looking for a free block.
2366  //
2367 
2368  do {
2369 
2370  //
2371  // If the list is not empty, then allocate a block from the
2372  // selected list.
2373  //
2374 
2375  if (PrivateIsListEmpty (ListHead) == FALSE) {
2376 
2377  LOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
2378 
2379  if (PrivateIsListEmpty (ListHead)) {
2380 
2381  //
2382  // The block is no longer available, march on.
2383  //
2384 
2385  UNLOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
2386  ListHead += 1;
2387  continue;
2388  }
2389 
2390  CHECK_LIST (ListHead);
2391  Block = PrivateRemoveHeadList (ListHead);
2392  CHECK_LIST (ListHead);
2393  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)Block - POOL_OVERHEAD);
2394 
2395  CHECK_POOL_PAGE (Entry);
2396 
2397  ASSERT(Entry->BlockSize >= NeededSize);
2398 
2399  ASSERT(DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry) == PoolIndex);
2400 
2401  ASSERT(Entry->PoolType == 0);
2402 
2403  if (Entry->BlockSize != NeededSize) {
2404 
2405  //
2406  // The selected block is larger than the allocation
2407  // request. Split the block and insert the remaining
2408  // fragment in the appropriate list.
2409  //
2410  // If the entry is at the start of a page, then take
2411  // the allocation from the front of the block so as
2412  // to minimize fragmentation. Otherwise, take the
2413  // allocation from the end of the block which may
2414  // also reduce fragmentation if the block is at the
2415  // end of a page.
2416  //
2417 
2418  if (Entry->PreviousSize == 0) {
2419 
2420  //
2421  // The entry is at the start of a page.
2422  //
2423 
2424  SplitEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + NeededSize);
2425  SplitEntry->BlockSize = (USHORT)(Entry->BlockSize - NeededSize);
2426  SplitEntry->PreviousSize = (USHORT) NeededSize;
2427 
2428  //
2429  // If the allocated block is not at the end of a
2430  // page, then adjust the size of the next block.
2431  //
2432 
2433  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)SplitEntry + SplitEntry->BlockSize);
2434  if (PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) {
2435  NextEntry->PreviousSize = SplitEntry->BlockSize;
2436  }
2437 
2438  }
2439  else {
2440 
2441  //
2442  // The entry is not at the start of a page.
2443  //
2444 
2445  SplitEntry = Entry;
2446  Entry->BlockSize = (USHORT)(Entry->BlockSize - NeededSize);
2447  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + Entry->BlockSize);
2448  Entry->PreviousSize = SplitEntry->BlockSize;
2449 
2450  //
2451  // If the allocated block is not at the end of a
2452  // page, then adjust the size of the next block.
2453  //
2454 
2455  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + NeededSize);
2456  if (PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) {
2457  NextEntry->PreviousSize = (USHORT) NeededSize;
2458  }
2459  }
2460 
2461  //
2462  // Set the size of the allocated entry, clear the pool
2463  // type of the split entry, set the index of the split
2464  // entry, and insert the split entry in the appropriate
2465  // free list.
2466  //
2467 
2468  Entry->BlockSize = (USHORT) NeededSize;
2469  ENCODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry, PoolIndex);
2470  SplitEntry->PoolType = 0;
2471  ENCODE_POOL_INDEX(SplitEntry, PoolIndex);
2472  Index = SplitEntry->BlockSize;
2473 
2474  CHECK_LIST(&PoolDesc->ListHeads[Index - 1]);
2475 
2476  //
2477  // Only insert split pool blocks which contain more than just
2478  // a header as only those have room for a flink/blink !
2479  // Note if the minimum pool block size is bigger than the
2480  // header then there can be no blocks like this.
2481  //
2482 
2483  if ((POOL_OVERHEAD != POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK) ||
2484  (SplitEntry->BlockSize != 1)) {
2485 
2486  PrivateInsertTailList(&PoolDesc->ListHeads[Index - 1], ((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)SplitEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
2487 
2488  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)SplitEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
2489  }
2490  }
2491 
2492  Entry->PoolType = (UCHAR)(((PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | POOL_QUOTA_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK | POOL_VERIFIER_MASK)) + 1) | POOL_IN_USE_MASK);
2493 
2494  CHECK_POOL_PAGE (Entry);
2495 
2496  UNLOCK_POOL(PoolDesc, LockHandle);
2497 
2498  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->RunningAllocs);
2499 
2500  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolDesc->TotalBytes,
2501  Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT);
2502 
2503  Entry->PoolTag = Tag;
2504 
2505  ExpInsertPoolTrackerInline (Tag,
2506  Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT,
2507  PoolType);
2508 
2509  //
2510  // Zero out any back pointer to our internal structures
2511  // to stop someone from corrupting us via an
2512  // uninitialized pointer.
2513  //
2514 
2515  ((PULONGLONG)((PCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead))[0] = 0;
2516 
2517  PERFINFO_POOLALLOC_ADDR((PUCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead);
2518  return (PCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead;
2519  }
2520 
2521  ListHead += 1;
2522 
2523  } while (ListHead != &PoolDesc->ListHeads[POOL_LIST_HEADS]);
2524 
2525  //
2526  // A block of the desired size does not exist and there are
2527  // no large blocks that can be split to satisfy the allocation.
2528  // Attempt to expand the pool by allocating another page and
2529  // adding it to the pool.
2530  //
2531 
2532  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER) MiAllocatePoolPages (RequestType, PAGE_SIZE);
2533 
2534  if (Entry == NULL) {
2535 
2536  //
2537  // If there are deferred free blocks, free them now and retry.
2538  //
2539 
2540  RetryCount += 1;
2541 
2542  if ((RetryCount == 1) && (ExpPoolFlags & EX_DELAY_POOL_FREES)) {
2543  ExDeferredFreePool (PoolDesc);
2544  goto restart2;
2545  }
2546 
2547  if ((PoolType & MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_TYPE_MASK) != 0) {
2548 
2549  //
2550  // Must succeed pool was requested so bugcheck.
2551  //
2552 
2553  KeBugCheckEx (MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_EMPTY,
2554  PAGE_SIZE,
2555  NonPagedPoolDescriptor.TotalPages,
2556  NonPagedPoolDescriptor.TotalBigPages,
2557  0);
2558  }
2559 
2560  //
2561  // No more pool of the specified type is available.
2562  //
2563 
2564  ExPoolFailures += 1;
2565 
2566  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_PRINT_POOL_FAILURES) {
2567  KdPrint(("EX: ExAllocatePool (%p, 0x%x) returning NULL\n",
2568  NumberOfBytes,
2569  PoolType));
2570  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_STOP_ON_POOL_FAILURES) {
2571  DbgBreakPoint ();
2572  }
2573  }
2574 
2575  if ((PoolType & POOL_RAISE_IF_ALLOCATION_FAILURE) != 0) {
2576  ExRaiseStatus (STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES);
2577  }
2578 
2579  PERFINFO_POOLALLOC_ADDR (NULL);
2580  return NULL;
2581  }
2582 
2583  //
2584  // Initialize the pool header for the new allocation.
2585  //
2586 
2587  Entry->Ulong1 = 0;
2588  Entry->PoolIndex = (UCHAR) PoolIndex;
2589  Entry->BlockSize = (USHORT) NeededSize;
2590 
2591  Entry->PoolType = (UCHAR)(((PoolType & (BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK | POOL_QUOTA_MASK | SESSION_POOL_MASK | POOL_VERIFIER_MASK)) + 1) | POOL_IN_USE_MASK);
2592 
2593 
2594  SplitEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + NeededSize);
2595 
2596  SplitEntry->Ulong1 = 0;
2597 
2598  Index = (PAGE_SIZE / sizeof(POOL_BLOCK)) - NeededSize;
2599 
2600  SplitEntry->BlockSize = (USHORT) Index;
2601  SplitEntry->PreviousSize = (USHORT) NeededSize;
2602  SplitEntry->PoolIndex = (UCHAR) PoolIndex;
2603 
2604  //
2605  // Split the allocated page and insert the remaining
2606  // fragment in the appropriate listhead.
2607  //
2608  // Set the size of the allocated entry, clear the pool
2609  // type of the split entry, set the index of the split
2610  // entry, and insert the split entry in the appropriate
2611  // free list.
2612  //
2613 
2614  //
2615  // Note that if the request was for nonpaged session pool, we are
2616  // not updating the session pool descriptor for this. Instead we
2617  // are deliberately updating the global nonpaged pool descriptor
2618  // because the rest of the fragment goes into global nonpaged pool.
2619  // This is ok because the session pool descriptor TotalPages count
2620  // is not relied upon.
2621  //
2622  // The individual pool tracking by tag, however, is critical and
2623  // is properly maintained below (ie: session allocations are charged
2624  // to the session tracking table and regular nonpaged allocations are
2625  // charged to the global nonpaged tracking table).
2626  //
2627 
2628  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->TotalPages);
2629 
2630  NeededSize <<= POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT;
2631 
2632  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolDesc->TotalBytes, NeededSize);
2633 
2634  PERFINFO_ADDPOOLPAGE(CheckType, PoolIndex, Entry, PoolDesc);
2635 
2636  //
2637  // Only insert split pool blocks which contain more than just
2638  // a header as only those have room for a flink/blink !
2639  // Note if the minimum pool block size is bigger than the
2640  // header then there can be no blocks like this.
2641  //
2642 
2643  if ((POOL_OVERHEAD != POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK) ||
2644  (SplitEntry->BlockSize != 1)) {
2645 
2646  //
2647  // Now lock the pool and insert the fragment.
2648  //
2649 
2650  LOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
2651 
2652  CHECK_LIST(&PoolDesc->ListHeads[Index - 1]);
2653 
2654  PrivateInsertTailList(&PoolDesc->ListHeads[Index - 1], ((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)SplitEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
2655 
2656  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)SplitEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
2657 
2658  CHECK_POOL_PAGE (Entry);
2659 
2660  UNLOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
2661  }
2662  else {
2663  CHECK_POOL_PAGE (Entry);
2664  }
2665 
2666  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->RunningAllocs);
2667 
2668  Block = (PVOID) ((PCHAR)Entry + CacheOverhead);
2669 
2670  Entry->PoolTag = Tag;
2671 
2672  ExpInsertPoolTrackerInline (Tag, NeededSize, PoolType);
2673 
2674  PERFINFO_POOLALLOC_ADDR (Block);
2675 
2676  return Block;
2677 }
2678 
2679 
2680 __bcount(NumberOfBytes)
2681 PVOID
2682 ExAllocatePool (
2683  __in POOL_TYPE PoolType,
2684  __in SIZE_T NumberOfBytes
2685  )
2686 
2687 /*++
2688 
2689 Routine Description:
2690 
2691  This function allocates a block of pool of the specified type and
2692  returns a pointer to the allocated block. This function is used to
2693  access both the page-aligned pools, and the list head entries (less than
2694  a page) pools.
2695 
2696  If the number of bytes specifies a size that is too large to be
2697  satisfied by the appropriate list, then the page-aligned
2698  pool allocator is used. The allocated block will be page-aligned
2699  and a page-sized multiple.
2700 
2701  Otherwise, the appropriate pool list entry is used. The allocated
2702  block will be 64-bit aligned, but will not be page aligned. The
2703  pool allocator calculates the smallest number of POOL_BLOCK_SIZE
2704  that can be used to satisfy the request. If there are no blocks
2705  available of this size, then a block of the next larger block size
2706  is allocated and split. One piece is placed back into the pool, and
2707  the other piece is used to satisfy the request. If the allocator
2708  reaches the paged-sized block list, and nothing is there, the
2709  page-aligned pool allocator is called. The page is split and added
2710  to the pool...
2711 
2712 Arguments:
2713 
2714  PoolType - Supplies the type of pool to allocate. If the pool type
2715  is one of the "MustSucceed" pool types, then this call will
2716  succeed and return a pointer to allocated pool or bugcheck on failure.
2717  For all other cases, if the system cannot allocate the requested amount
2718  of memory, NULL is returned.
2719 
2720  Valid pool types:
2721 
2722  NonPagedPool
2723  PagedPool
2724  NonPagedPoolMustSucceed,
2725  NonPagedPoolCacheAligned
2726  PagedPoolCacheAligned
2727  NonPagedPoolCacheAlignedMustS
2728 
2729  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the number of bytes to allocate.
2730 
2731 Return Value:
2732 
2733  NULL - The PoolType is not one of the "MustSucceed" pool types, and
2734  not enough pool exists to satisfy the request.
2735 
2736  NON-NULL - Returns a pointer to the allocated pool.
2737 
2738 --*/
2739 
2740 {
2741  return ExAllocatePoolWithTag (PoolType,
2742  NumberOfBytes,
2743  'enoN');
2744 }
2745 
2746 
2747 __bcount(NumberOfBytes)
2748 PVOID
2749 ExAllocatePoolWithTagPriority (
2750  __in POOL_TYPE PoolType,
2751  __in SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
2752  __in ULONG Tag,
2753  __in EX_POOL_PRIORITY Priority
2754  )
2755 
2756 /*++
2757 
2758 Routine Description:
2759 
2760  This function allocates a block of pool of the specified type and
2761  returns a pointer to the allocated block. This function is used to
2762  access both the page-aligned pools, and the list head entries (less than
2763  a page) pools.
2764 
2765  If the number of bytes specifies a size that is too large to be
2766  satisfied by the appropriate list, then the page-aligned
2767  pool allocator is used. The allocated block will be page-aligned
2768  and a page-sized multiple.
2769 
2770  Otherwise, the appropriate pool list entry is used. The allocated
2771  block will be 64-bit aligned, but will not be page aligned. The
2772  pool allocator calculates the smallest number of POOL_BLOCK_SIZE
2773  that can be used to satisfy the request. If there are no blocks
2774  available of this size, then a block of the next larger block size
2775  is allocated and split. One piece is placed back into the pool, and
2776  the other piece is used to satisfy the request. If the allocator
2777  reaches the paged-sized block list, and nothing is there, the
2778  page-aligned pool allocator is called. The page is split and added
2779  to the pool...
2780 
2781 Arguments:
2782 
2783  PoolType - Supplies the type of pool to allocate. If the pool type
2784  is one of the "MustSucceed" pool types, then this call will
2785  succeed and return a pointer to allocated pool or bugcheck on failure.
2786  For all other cases, if the system cannot allocate the requested amount
2787  of memory, NULL is returned.
2788 
2789  Valid pool types:
2790 
2791  NonPagedPool
2792  PagedPool
2793  NonPagedPoolMustSucceed,
2794  NonPagedPoolCacheAligned
2795  PagedPoolCacheAligned
2796  NonPagedPoolCacheAlignedMustS
2797 
2798  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the number of bytes to allocate.
2799 
2800  Tag - Supplies the caller's identifying tag.
2801 
2802  Priority - Supplies an indication as to how important it is that this
2803  request succeed under low available pool conditions. This
2804  can also be used to specify special pool.
2805 
2806 Return Value:
2807 
2808  NULL - The PoolType is not one of the "MustSucceed" pool types, and
2809  not enough pool exists to satisfy the request.
2810 
2811  NON-NULL - Returns a pointer to the allocated pool.
2812 
2813 --*/
2814 
2815 {
2816  ULONG i;
2817  ULONG Ratio;
2818  PVOID Entry;
2819  SIZE_T TotalBytes;
2820  SIZE_T TotalFullPages;
2821  POOL_TYPE CheckType;
2822  PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR PoolDesc;
2823 
2824  if ((Priority & POOL_SPECIAL_POOL_BIT) && (NumberOfBytes <= POOL_BUDDY_MAX)) {
2825  Entry = MmAllocateSpecialPool (NumberOfBytes,
2826  Tag,
2827  PoolType,
2828  (Priority & POOL_SPECIAL_POOL_UNDERRUN_BIT) ? 1 : 0);
2829 
2830  if (Entry != NULL) {
2831  return Entry;
2832  }
2833  Priority &= ~(POOL_SPECIAL_POOL_BIT | POOL_SPECIAL_POOL_UNDERRUN_BIT);
2834  }
2835 
2836  //
2837  // Pool and other resources can be allocated directly through the Mm
2838  // without the pool code knowing - so always call the Mm for the
2839  // up-to-date counters.
2840  //
2841 
2842  if ((Priority != HighPoolPriority) &&
2843  ((PoolType & MUST_SUCCEED_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == 0)) {
2844 
2845  if (MmResourcesAvailable (PoolType, NumberOfBytes, Priority) == FALSE) {
2846 
2847  //
2848  // The Mm does not have very many full pages left. Leave those
2849  // for true high priority callers. But first see if this request
2850  // is small, and if so, if there is a lot of fragmentation, then
2851  // it is likely the request can be satisfied from pre-existing
2852  // fragments.
2853  //
2854 
2855  if (NumberOfBytes > POOL_BUDDY_MAX) {
2856  return NULL;
2857  }
2858 
2859  //
2860  // Sum the pool descriptors.
2861  //
2862 
2863  CheckType = PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK;
2864 
2865  if ((CheckType == NonPagedPool) ||
2866  ((PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) == 0)) {
2867 
2868  PoolDesc = PoolVector[CheckType];
2869 
2870  TotalBytes = 0;
2871  TotalFullPages = 0;
2872 
2873  if (CheckType == PagedPool) {
2874 
2875  if (KeNumberNodes > 1) {
2876  for (i = 0; i <= ExpNumberOfPagedPools; i += 1) {
2877  PoolDesc = ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[i];
2878  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalPages;
2879  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalBigPages;
2880  TotalBytes += PoolDesc->TotalBytes;
2881  }
2882  }
2883  else {
2884  for (i = 0; i <= ExpNumberOfPagedPools; i += 1) {
2885  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalPages;
2886  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalBigPages;
2887  TotalBytes += PoolDesc->TotalBytes;
2888  PoolDesc += 1;
2889  }
2890  }
2891  }
2892  else {
2893  if (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools == 1) {
2894  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalPages;
2895  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalBigPages;
2896  TotalBytes += PoolDesc->TotalBytes;
2897  }
2898  else {
2899  for (i = 0; i < ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools; i += 1) {
2900  PoolDesc = ExpNonPagedPoolDescriptor[i];
2901  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalPages;
2902  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalBigPages;
2903  TotalBytes += PoolDesc->TotalBytes;
2904  }
2905  }
2906  }
2907  }
2908  else {
2909  PoolDesc = ExpSessionPoolDescriptor;
2910  TotalFullPages = PoolDesc->TotalPages;
2911  TotalFullPages += PoolDesc->TotalBigPages;
2912  TotalBytes = PoolDesc->TotalBytes;
2913  }
2914 
2915  //
2916  // If the pages are more than 80% populated then don't assume
2917  // we're going to be able to satisfy ths request via a fragment.
2918  //
2919 
2920  TotalFullPages |= 1; // Ensure we never divide by zero.
2921  TotalBytes >>= PAGE_SHIFT;
2922 
2923  //
2924  // The additions above were performed lock free so we must handle
2925  // slicing which can cause nonexact sums.
2926  //
2927 
2928  if (TotalBytes > TotalFullPages) {
2929  TotalBytes = TotalFullPages;
2930  }
2931 
2932  Ratio = (ULONG)((TotalBytes * 100) / TotalFullPages);
2933 
2934  if (Ratio >= 80) {
2935  return NULL;
2936  }
2937  }
2938  }
2939 
2940  //
2941  // There is a window between determining whether to proceed and actually
2942  // doing the allocation. In this window the pool may deplete. This is not
2943  // worth closing at this time.
2944  //
2945 
2946  return ExAllocatePoolWithTag (PoolType, NumberOfBytes, Tag);
2947 }

2949 
2950 __bcount(NumberOfBytes)
2951 PVOID
2952 ExAllocatePoolWithQuota (
2953  __in POOL_TYPE PoolType,
2954  __in SIZE_T NumberOfBytes
2955  )
2956 
2957 /*++
2958 
2959 Routine Description:
2960 
2961  This function allocates a block of pool of the specified type,
2962  returns a pointer to the allocated block, and if the binary buddy
2963  allocator was used to satisfy the request, charges pool quota to the
2964  current process. This function is used to access both the
2965  page-aligned pools, and the binary buddy.
2966 
2967  If the number of bytes specifies a size that is too large to be
2968  satisfied by the appropriate binary buddy pool, then the
2969  page-aligned pool allocator is used. The allocated block will be
2970  page-aligned and a page-sized multiple. No quota is charged to the
2971  current process if this is the case.
2972 
2973  Otherwise, the appropriate binary buddy pool is used. The allocated
2974  block will be 64-bit aligned, but will not be page aligned. After
2975  the allocation completes, an attempt will be made to charge pool
2976  quota (of the appropriate type) to the current process object. If
2977  the quota charge succeeds, then the pool block's header is adjusted
2978  to point to the current process. The process object is not
2979  dereferenced until the pool is deallocated and the appropriate
2980  amount of quota is returned to the process. Otherwise, the pool is
2981  deallocated, a "quota exceeded" condition is raised.
2982 
2983 Arguments:
2984 
2985  PoolType - Supplies the type of pool to allocate. If the pool type
2986  is one of the "MustSucceed" pool types and sufficient quota
2987  exists, then this call will always succeed and return a pointer
2988  to allocated pool. Otherwise, if the system cannot allocate
2989  the requested amount of memory a STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES
2990  status is raised.
2991 
2992  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the number of bytes to allocate.
2993 
2994 Return Value:
2995 
2996  NON-NULL - Returns a pointer to the allocated pool.
2997 
2998  Unspecified - If insufficient quota exists to complete the pool
2999  allocation, the return value is unspecified.
3000 
3001 --*/
3002 
3003 {
3004  return ExAllocatePoolWithQuotaTag (PoolType, NumberOfBytes, 'enoN');
3005 }

3023 #endif

3042  __in SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
3043  __in ULONG Tag
3044  )
