3047 
3048 Routine Description:
3049 
3050  This function allocates a block of pool of the specified type,
3051  returns a pointer to the allocated block, and if the binary buddy
3052  allocator was used to satisfy the request, charges pool quota to the
3053  current process. This function is used to access both the
3054  page-aligned pools, and the binary buddy.
3055 
3056  If the number of bytes specifies a size that is too large to be
3057  satisfied by the appropriate binary buddy pool, then the
3058  page-aligned pool allocator is used. The allocated block will be
3059  page-aligned and a page-sized multiple. No quota is charged to the
3060  current process if this is the case.
3061 
3062  Otherwise, the appropriate binary buddy pool is used. The allocated
3063  block will be 64-bit aligned, but will not be page aligned. After
3064  the allocation completes, an attempt will be made to charge pool
3065  quota (of the appropriate type) to the current process object. If
3066  the quota charge succeeds, then the pool block's header is adjusted
3067  to point to the current process. The process object is not
3068  dereferenced until the pool is deallocated and the appropriate
3069  amount of quota is returned to the process. Otherwise, the pool is
3070  deallocated, a "quota exceeded" condition is raised.
3071 
3072 Arguments:
3073 
3074  PoolType - Supplies the type of pool to allocate. If the pool type
3075  is one of the "MustSucceed" pool types and sufficient quota
3076  exists, then this call will always succeed and return a pointer
3077  to allocated pool. Otherwise, if the system cannot allocate
3078  the requested amount of memory a STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES
3079  status is raised.
3080 
3081  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the number of bytes to allocate.
3082 
3083 Return Value:
3084 
3085  NON-NULL - Returns a pointer to the allocated pool.
3086 
3087  Unspecified - If insufficient quota exists to complete the pool
3088  allocation, the return value is unspecified.
3089 
3090 --*/
3091 
3092 {
3093  PVOID p;
3094  PEPROCESS Process;
3095  PPOOL_HEADER Entry;
3096  LOGICAL RaiseOnQuotaFailure;
3097  NTSTATUS Status;
3098 #if DBG
3099  LONG ConcurrentQuotaPool;
3100 #endif
3101 
3102  RaiseOnQuotaFailure = TRUE;
3103 
3104  if (PoolType & POOL_QUOTA_FAIL_INSTEAD_OF_RAISE) {
3105  RaiseOnQuotaFailure = FALSE;
3106  PoolType &= ~POOL_QUOTA_FAIL_INSTEAD_OF_RAISE;
3107  }
3108 
3109  PoolType = (POOL_TYPE)((UCHAR)PoolType + POOL_QUOTA_MASK);
3110 
3111  Process = PsGetCurrentProcess ();
3112 
3113 #if !defined(_WIN64)
3114 
3115  //
3116  // Add in room for the quota pointer at the end of the caller's allocation.
3117  // Note for NT64, there is room in the pool header for both the tag and
3118  // the quota pointer so no extra space is needed at the end.
3119  //
3120  // Only add in the quota pointer if doing so won't cause us to spill the
3121  // allocation into a full page.
3122  //
3123 
3124  ASSERT (NumberOfBytes != 0);
3125 
3126  if (NumberOfBytes <= PAGE_SIZE - POOL_OVERHEAD - sizeof (PVOID)) {
3127  if (Process != PsInitialSystemProcess) {
3128  NumberOfBytes += sizeof (PVOID);
3129  }
3130  else {
3131  PoolType = (POOL_TYPE)((UCHAR)PoolType - POOL_QUOTA_MASK);
3132  }
3133  }
3134  else {
3135 
3136  //
3137  // Turn off the quota bit prior to allocating if we're not charging
3138  // as there's no room to put (or subsequently query for) a quota
3139  // pointer.
3140  //
3141 
3142  PoolType = (POOL_TYPE)((UCHAR)PoolType - POOL_QUOTA_MASK);
3143  }
3144 
3145 #endif
3146 
3147  p = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (PoolType, NumberOfBytes, Tag);
3148 
3149  //
3150  // Note - NULL is page aligned.
3151  //
3152 
3153  if (!PAGE_ALIGNED(p)) {
3154 
3155  if ((ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) &&
3156  (MmIsSpecialPoolAddress (p))) {
3157  return p;
3158  }
3159 
3160  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCH)p - POOL_OVERHEAD);
3161 
3162 #if defined(_WIN64)
3163  Entry->ProcessBilled = NULL;
3164 #else
3165  if ((PoolType & POOL_QUOTA_MASK) == 0) {
3166  return p;
3167  }
3168 #endif
3169 
3170  if (Process != PsInitialSystemProcess) {
3171 
3172  Status = PsChargeProcessPoolQuota (Process,
3173  PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK,
3174  (ULONG)(Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT));
3175 
3176 
3177  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
3178 
3179  //
3180  // Back out the allocation.
3181  //
3182 
3183 #if !defined(_WIN64)
3184  //
3185  // The quota flag cannot be blindly cleared in NT32 because
3186  // it's used to denote the allocation is larger (and the
3187  // verifier finds its own header based on this).
3188  //
3189  // Instead of clearing the flag above, instead zero the quota
3190  // pointer.
3191  //
3192 
3193  * (PVOID *)((PCHAR)Entry + (Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT) - sizeof (PVOID)) = NULL;
3194 #endif
3195 
3196  ExFreePoolWithTag (p, Tag);
3197 
3198  if (RaiseOnQuotaFailure) {
3199  ExRaiseStatus (Status);
3200  }
3201  return NULL;
3202  }
3203 
3204 #if DBG
3205  ConcurrentQuotaPool = InterlockedIncrement (&ExConcurrentQuotaPool);
3206  if (ConcurrentQuotaPool > ExConcurrentQuotaPoolMax) {
3207  ExConcurrentQuotaPoolMax = ConcurrentQuotaPool;
3208  }
3209 #endif
3210 
3211 #if defined(_WIN64)
3212  Entry->ProcessBilled = Process;
3213 #else
3214 
3215  * (PVOID *)((PCHAR)Entry + (Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT) - sizeof (PVOID)) = Process;
3216 
3217 #endif
3218 
3219  ObReferenceObject (Process);
3220  }
3221  }
3222  else {
3223  if ((p == NULL) && (RaiseOnQuotaFailure)) {
3224  ExRaiseStatus (STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES);
3225  }
3226  }
3227 
3228  return p;
3229 }

3302  that the hash generated for these tags always gets a direct hit.

3326  ' oI',

3434 
3435 VOID
3436 ExpInsertPoolTrackerExpansion (
3437  IN ULONG Key,
3438  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
3439  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType
3440  )
3441 
3442 /*++
3443 
3444 Routine Description:
3445 
3446  This function inserts a pool tag in the expansion tag table (taking a
3447  spinlock to do so), increments the number of allocates and updates
3448  the total allocation size.
3449 
3450 Arguments:
3451 
3452  Key - Supplies the key value used to locate a matching entry in the
3453  tag table.
3454 
3455  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the allocation size.
3456 
3457  PoolType - Supplies the pool type.
3458 
3459 Return Value:
3460 
3461  None.
3462 
3463 Environment:
3464 
3465  No pool locks held so pool may be freely allocated here as needed.
3466 
3467  This routine is only called if ExpInsertPoolTracker encounters a full
3468  builtin list.
3469 
3470 --*/
3471 
3472 {
3473  ULONG Hash;
3474  KIRQL OldIrql;
3475  ULONG BigPages;
3476  SIZE_T NewSize;
3477  SIZE_T SizeInBytes;
3478  SIZE_T NewSizeInBytes;
3479  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE OldTable;
3480  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE NewTable;
3481 
3482  //
3483  // The protected pool bit has already been stripped.
3484  //
3485 
3486  ASSERT ((Key & PROTECTED_POOL) == 0);
3487 
3488  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
3489 
3490  //
3491  // Use the very last entry as a bit bucket for overflows.
3492  //
3493 
3494  NewTable = ExpSessionPoolTrackTable + ExpSessionPoolTrackTableSize - 1;
3495 
3496  ASSERT ((NewTable->Key == 0) || (NewTable->Key == 'lfvO'));
3497 
3498  NewTable->Key = 'lfvO';
3499 
3500  //
3501  // Update the fields with interlocked operations as other
3502  // threads may also have begun doing so by this point.
3503  //
3504 
3505  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
3506  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &NewTable->PagedAllocs);
3507  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&NewTable->PagedBytes,
3508  NumberOfBytes);
3509  }
3510  else {
3511  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &NewTable->NonPagedAllocs);
3512  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&NewTable->NonPagedBytes,
3513  NumberOfBytes);
3514  }
3515  return;
3516  }
3517 
3518  //
3519  // Linear search through the expansion table. This is ok because
3520  // the case of no free entries in the built-in table is extremely rare.
3521  //
3522 
3523  ExAcquireSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, &OldIrql);
3524 
3525  for (Hash = 0; Hash < PoolTrackTableExpansionSize; Hash += 1) {
3526 
3527  if (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].Key == Key) {
3528  break;
3529  }
3530 
3531  if (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].Key == 0) {
3532  ASSERT (PoolTrackTable[PoolTrackTableSize - 1].Key == 0);
3533  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].Key = Key;
3534  break;
3535  }
3536  }
3537 
3538  if (Hash != PoolTrackTableExpansionSize) {
3539 
3540  //
3541  // The entry was found (or created). Update the other fields now.
3542  //
3543 
3544  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
3545  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedAllocs += 1;
3546  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedBytes += NumberOfBytes;
3547  }
3548  else {
3549  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedAllocs += 1;
3550  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedBytes += NumberOfBytes;
3551  }
3552 
3553  ExReleaseSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, OldIrql);
3554  return;
3555  }
3556 
3557  //
3558  // The entry was not found and the expansion table is full (or nonexistent).
3559  // Try to allocate a larger expansion table now.
3560  //
3561 
3562  if (PoolTrackTable[PoolTrackTableSize - 1].Key != 0) {
3563 
3564  //
3565  // The overflow bucket has been used so expansion of the tracker table
3566  // is not allowed because a subsequent free of a tag can go negative
3567  // as the original allocation is in overflow and a newer allocation
3568  // may be distinct.
3569  //
3570 
3571  //
3572  // Use the very last entry as a bit bucket for overflows.
3573  //
3574 
3575  ExReleaseSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, OldIrql);
3576 
3577  Hash = (ULONG)PoolTrackTableSize - 1;
3578 
3579  //
3580  // Update the fields with interlocked operations as other
3581  // threads may also have begun doing so by this point.
3582  //
3583 
3584  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
3585  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &PoolTrackTable[Hash].PagedAllocs);
3586  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolTrackTable[Hash].PagedBytes,
3587  NumberOfBytes);
3588  }
3589  else {
3590  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &PoolTrackTable[Hash].NonPagedAllocs);
3591  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolTrackTable[Hash].NonPagedBytes,
3592  NumberOfBytes);
3593 
3594  }
3595 
3596  return;
3597  }
3598 
3599  SizeInBytes = PoolTrackTableExpansionSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE);
3600 
3601  //
3602  // Use as much of the slush in the final page as possible.
3603  //
3604 
3605  NewSizeInBytes = (PoolTrackTableExpansionPages + 1) << PAGE_SHIFT;
3606  NewSize = NewSizeInBytes / sizeof (POOL_TRACKER_TABLE);
3607  NewSizeInBytes = NewSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE);
3608 
3609  NewTable = MiAllocatePoolPages (NonPagedPool, NewSizeInBytes);
3610 
3611  if (NewTable != NULL) {
3612 
3613  if (PoolTrackTableExpansion != NULL) {
3614 
3615  //
3616  // Copy all the existing entries into the new table.
3617  //
3618 
3619  RtlCopyMemory (NewTable,
3620  PoolTrackTableExpansion,
3621  SizeInBytes);
3622  }
3623 
3624  RtlZeroMemory ((PVOID)(NewTable + PoolTrackTableExpansionSize),
3625  NewSizeInBytes - SizeInBytes);
3626 
3627  OldTable = PoolTrackTableExpansion;
3628 
3629  PoolTrackTableExpansion = NewTable;
3630  PoolTrackTableExpansionSize = NewSize;
3631  PoolTrackTableExpansionPages += 1;
3632 
3633  //
3634  // Recursively call ourself to insert the new table entry. This entry
3635  // must be inserted before releasing the tagged spinlock because
3636  // another thread may be further growing the table and as soon as we
3637  // release the spinlock, that thread may grow and try to free our
3638  // new table !
3639  //
3640 
3641  ExpInsertPoolTracker ('looP',
3642  PoolTrackTableExpansionPages << PAGE_SHIFT,
3643  NonPagedPool);
3644 
3645  ExReleaseSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, OldIrql);
3646 
3647  //
3648  // Free the old table if there was one.
3649  //
3650 
3651  if (OldTable != NULL) {
3652 
3653  BigPages = MiFreePoolPages (OldTable);
3654 
3655  ExpRemovePoolTracker ('looP',
3656  (SIZE_T) BigPages * PAGE_SIZE,
3657  NonPagedPool);
3658  }
3659 
3660  //
3661  // Finally insert the caller's original allocation.
3662  //
3663 
3664  ExpInsertPoolTrackerExpansion (Key, NumberOfBytes, PoolType);
3665  }
3666  else {
3667 
3668  //
3669  // Use the very last entry as a bit bucket for overflows.
3670  //
3671 
3672  Hash = (ULONG)PoolTrackTableSize - 1;
3673 
3674  ASSERT (PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key == 0);
3675 
3676  PoolTrackTable[Hash].Key = 'lfvO';
3677 
3678  ExReleaseSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, OldIrql);
3679 
3680  //
3681  // Update the fields with interlocked operations as other
3682  // threads may also have begun doing so by this point.
3683  //
3684 
3685  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
3686  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &PoolTrackTable[Hash].PagedAllocs);
3687  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolTrackTable[Hash].PagedBytes,
3688  NumberOfBytes);
3689  }
3690  else {
3691  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &PoolTrackTable[Hash].NonPagedAllocs);
3692  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolTrackTable[Hash].NonPagedBytes,
3693  NumberOfBytes);
3694  }
3695  }
3696 
3697  return;
3698 }

3704  )

3711 ExpRemovePoolTrackerExpansion (
3712  IN ULONG Key,
3713  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
3714  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType
3715  )
3716 
3717 /*++
3718 
3719 Routine Description:
3720 
3721  This function increments the number of frees and updates the total
3722  allocation size in the expansion table.
3723 
3724 Arguments:
3725 
3726  Key - Supplies the key value used to locate a matching entry in the
3727  tag table.
3728 
3729  NumberOfBytes - Supplies the allocation size.
3730 
3731  PoolType - Supplies the pool type.
3732 
3733 Return Value:
3734 
3735  None.
3736 
3737 --*/
3738 
3739 {
3740  ULONG Hash;
3741  KIRQL OldIrql;
3742  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackTable;
3743 #if !defined (NT_UP)
3744  ULONG Processor;
3745 #endif
3746 
3747  //
3748  // The protected pool bit has already been stripped.
3749  //
3750 
3751  ASSERT ((Key & PROTECTED_POOL) == 0);
3752 
3753  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
3754 
3755  //
3756  // This entry must have been charged to the overflow bucket.
3757  // Update the pool tracker table entry for it.
3758  //
3759 
3760  Hash = (ULONG)ExpSessionPoolTrackTableSize - 1;
3761  TrackTable = ExpSessionPoolTrackTable;
3762  goto OverflowEntry;
3763  }
3764 
3765  //
3766  // Linear search through the expansion table. This is ok because
3767  // the existence of an expansion table at all is extremely rare.
3768  //
3769 
3770  ExAcquireSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, &OldIrql);
3771 
3772  for (Hash = 0; Hash < PoolTrackTableExpansionSize; Hash += 1) {
3773 
3774  if (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].Key == Key) {
3775 
3776  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
3777  ASSERT (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedAllocs != 0);
3778  ASSERT (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedAllocs >=
3779  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedFrees);
3780  ASSERT (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedBytes >= NumberOfBytes);
3781  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedFrees += 1;
3782  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].PagedBytes -= NumberOfBytes;
3783  }
3784  else {
3785  ASSERT (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedAllocs != 0);
3786  ASSERT (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedAllocs >=
3787  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedFrees);
3788  ASSERT (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedBytes >= NumberOfBytes);
3789  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedFrees += 1;
3790  PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].NonPagedBytes -= NumberOfBytes;
3791  }
3792 
3793  ExReleaseSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, OldIrql);
3794  return;
3795  }
3796  if (PoolTrackTableExpansion[Hash].Key == 0) {
3797  break;
3798  }
3799  }
3800 
3801  ExReleaseSpinLock (&ExpTaggedPoolLock, OldIrql);
3802 
3803  //
3804  // This entry must have been charged to the overflow bucket.
3805  // Update the pool tracker table entry for it.
3806  //
3807 
3808  Hash = (ULONG)PoolTrackTableSize - 1;
3809 
3810 #if !defined (NT_UP)
3811 
3812  //
3813  // Use the current processor to pick a pool tag table to use. Note that
3814  // in rare cases, this thread may context switch to another processor but
3815  // the algorithms below will still be correct.
3816  //
3817 
3818  Processor = KeGetCurrentProcessorNumber ();
3819 
3820  ASSERT (Processor < MAXIMUM_PROCESSOR_TAG_TABLES);
3821 
3822  TrackTable = ExPoolTagTables[Processor];
3823 
3824 #else
3825 
3826  TrackTable = PoolTrackTable;
3827 
3828 #endif
3829 
3830 OverflowEntry:
3831 
3832  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
3833 #if defined (NT_UP)
3834  ASSERT (TrackTable[Hash].PagedAllocs != 0);
3835  ASSERT (TrackTable[Hash].PagedBytes >= NumberOfBytes);
3836 #endif
3837  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &TrackTable[Hash].PagedFrees);
3838  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&TrackTable[Hash].PagedBytes,
3839  0 - NumberOfBytes);
3840  }
3841  else {
3842 #if defined (NT_UP)
3843  ASSERT (TrackTable[Hash].NonPagedAllocs != 0);
3844  ASSERT (TrackTable[Hash].NonPagedBytes >= NumberOfBytes);
3845 #endif
3846  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &TrackTable[Hash].NonPagedFrees);
3847  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&TrackTable[Hash].NonPagedBytes,
3848  0 - NumberOfBytes);
3849  }
3850  return;
3851 }
3852 
3853 VOID
3854 ExpRemovePoolTracker (
3855  IN ULONG Key,
3856  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes,
3857  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType
3858  )
3859 {
3860  ExpRemovePoolTrackerInline (Key, NumberOfBytes, PoolType);
3861 }
3862 
3863 
3864 LOGICAL
3865 ExpExpandBigPageTable (
3866  IN KIRQL OldIrql
3867  )
3868 
3869 /*++
3870 
3871 Routine Description:
3872 
3873  This function expands the big page tracking table and rehashes all the
3874  old entries into the new table at the same time.
3875 
3876 Arguments:
3877 
3878  OldIrql - Supplies the IRQL the pool track table spinlock was acquired at.
3879 
3880 Return Value:
3881 
3882  TRUE if the table was expanded, FALSE if not.
3883 
3884 Environment:
3885 
3886  Pool track table executive spinlock held exclusive at DISPATCH_LEVEL.
3887 
3888  The spinlock is released here (and IRQL lowered) prior to returning !!!
3889 
3890 --*/
3891 {
3892  ULONG Hash;
3893  ULONG NewHash;
3894  ULONG BigPages;
3895  SIZE_T SizeInBytes;
3896  SIZE_T NewSizeInBytes;
3897  SIZE_T TableSize;
3898  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES Table;
3899  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES TableEnd;
3900  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES NewTable;
3901 
3902  //
3903  // Try to expand the tracker table.
3904  //
3905 
3906  TableSize = PoolBigPageTableSize;
3907 
3908  SizeInBytes = TableSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES);
3909 
3910  NewSizeInBytes = (SizeInBytes << 1);
3911 
3912  if (NewSizeInBytes <= SizeInBytes) {
3913  ExReleaseSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
3914  return FALSE;
3915  }
3916 
3917  NewTable = MiAllocatePoolPages (NonPagedPool, NewSizeInBytes);
3918 
3919  if (NewTable == NULL) {
3920  ExReleaseSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
3921  return FALSE;
3922  }
3923 
3924  //
3925  // Initialize the new table, marking all the new entries as free.
3926  // Note this loop uses the fact that the table size always doubles.
3927  //
3928 
3929  RtlZeroMemory (NewTable, NewSizeInBytes);
3930 
3931  Table = NewTable;
3932  TableEnd = NewTable + (TableSize << 1);
3933 
3934  do {
3935  Table->Va = (PVOID) POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE;
3936  Table += 1;
3937  } while (Table != TableEnd);
3938 
3939  //
3940  // Rehash the valid tables in the old table
3941  // into their new locations in the new table.
3942  //
3943 
3944  Table = PoolBigPageTable;
3945  TableEnd = Table + TableSize;
3946 
3947  NewHash = (ULONG) ((TableSize << 1) - 1);
3948 
3949  do {
3950 
3951  if (((ULONG_PTR)Table->Va & POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE) == 0) {
3952 
3953  Hash = (ULONG)(((ULONG_PTR)Table->Va) >> PAGE_SHIFT);
3954  Hash = ((Hash >> 24) ^ (Hash >> 16) ^ (Hash >> 8) ^ Hash);
3955 
3956  Hash &= NewHash;
3957 
3958  while (((ULONG_PTR)NewTable[Hash].Va & POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE) == 0) {
3959  Hash += 1;
3960  if (Hash > NewHash) {
3961  Hash = 0;
3962  }
3963  }
3964 
3965  * (&NewTable[Hash]) = *Table;
3966  }
3967 
3968  Table += 1;
3969 
3970  } while (Table != TableEnd);
3971 
3972  Table = PoolBigPageTable;
3973  PoolBigPageTable = NewTable;
3974  PoolBigPageTableSize = (TableSize << 1);
3975  PoolBigPageTableHash = NewHash;
3976 
3977  ExReleaseSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
3978 
3979  //
3980  // The table growth has completed, release the spinlock.
3981  //
3982 
3983  BigPages = MiFreePoolPages (Table);
3984 
3985  ExpRemovePoolTracker ('looP',
3986  (SIZE_T) BigPages * PAGE_SIZE,
3987  NonPagedPool);
3988 
3989  ExpInsertPoolTracker ('looP',
3990  ROUND_TO_PAGES (NewSizeInBytes),
3991  NonPagedPool);
3992 
3993  return TRUE;
3994 }
3995 
3996 
3997 LOGICAL
3998 ExpAddTagForBigPages (
3999  IN PVOID Va,
4000  IN ULONG Key,
4001  IN ULONG NumberOfPages,
4002  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType
4003  )
4004 
4005 /*++
4006 
4007 Routine Description:
4008 
4009  This function inserts a pool tag in the big page tag table.
4010 
4011 Arguments:
4012 
4013  Va - Supplies the allocated virtual address.
4014 
4015  Key - Supplies the key value used to locate a matching entry in the
4016  tag table.
4017 
4018  NumberOfPages - Supplies the number of pages that were allocated.
4019 
4020  PoolType - Supplies the type of the pool.
4021 
4022 Return Value:
4023 
4024  TRUE if an entry was allocated, FALSE if not.
4025 
4026 Environment:
4027 
4028  No pool locks held so the table may be freely expanded here as needed.
4029 
4030 --*/
4031 {
4032  ULONG Hash;
4033  ULONG IterationCount;
4034  PVOID OldVa;
4035  KIRQL OldIrql;
4036  SIZE_T TableSize;
4037  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES Entry;
4038  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES EntryEnd;
4039  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES EntryStart;
4040 
4041  //
4042  // The low bit of the address is set to indicate a free entry. The high
4043  // bit cannot be used because in some configurations the high bit is not
4044  // set for all kernelmode addresses.
4045  //
4046 
4047  ASSERT (((ULONG_PTR)Va & POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE) == 0);
4048 
4049  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
4050  Hash = (ULONG)(((ULONG_PTR)Va) >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4051  Hash = ((Hash >> 24) ^ (Hash >> 16) ^ (Hash >> 8) ^ Hash);
4052  Hash &= ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableHash;
4053 
4054  TableSize = ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableSize;
4055 
4056  Entry = &ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[Hash];
4057  EntryStart = Entry;
4058  EntryEnd = &ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[TableSize];
4059 
4060  do {
4061 
4062  OldVa = Entry->Va;
4063 
4064  if (((ULONG_PTR)OldVa & POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE) &&
4065  (InterlockedCompareExchangePointer (&Entry->Va,
4066  Va,
4067  OldVa) == OldVa)) {
4068 
4069  Entry->Key = Key;
4070  Entry->NumberOfPages = NumberOfPages;
4071 
4072  return TRUE;
4073  }
4074 
4075  Entry += 1;
4076  if (Entry >= EntryEnd) {
4077  Entry = &ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[0];
4078  }
4079  } while (Entry != EntryStart);
4080 
4081 #if DBG
4082  ExpLargeSessionPoolUnTracked += 1;
4083 #endif
4084  return FALSE;
4085  }
4086 
4087  IterationCount = 0;
4088 
4089  do {
4090 
4091  Hash = (ULONG)(((ULONG_PTR)Va) >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4092  Hash = ((Hash >> 24) ^ (Hash >> 16) ^ (Hash >> 8) ^ Hash);
4093 
4094  OldIrql = ExAcquireSpinLockShared (&ExpLargePoolTableLock);
4095 
4096  Hash &= PoolBigPageTableHash;
4097 
4098  TableSize = PoolBigPageTableSize;
4099 
4100  Entry = &PoolBigPageTable[Hash];
4101  EntryStart = Entry;
4102  EntryEnd = &PoolBigPageTable[TableSize];
4103 
4104  do {
4105 
4106  OldVa = Entry->Va;
4107 
4108  if (((ULONG_PTR)OldVa & POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE) &&
4109  (InterlockedCompareExchangePointer (&Entry->Va,
4110  Va,
4111  OldVa) == OldVa)) {
4112 
4113  Entry->Key = Key;
4114  Entry->NumberOfPages = NumberOfPages;
4115 
4116  InterlockedIncrement (&ExpPoolBigEntriesInUse);
4117 
4118  if ((IterationCount >= 16) &&
4119  ((ULONG) ExpPoolBigEntriesInUse > (ULONG) (TableSize / 4))) {
4120 
4121  if (ExTryAcquireSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock) == TRUE) {
4122  ASSERT (TableSize == PoolBigPageTableSize);
4123 
4124  //
4125  // The expansion function always releases the lock.
4126  //
4127 
4128  ExpExpandBigPageTable (OldIrql);
4129  }
4130  else {
4131  ExReleaseSpinLockShared (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
4132  }
4133  }
4134  else {
4135  ExReleaseSpinLockShared (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
4136  }
4137 
4138  return TRUE;
4139  }
4140 
4141  IterationCount += 1;
4142  Entry += 1;
4143  if (Entry >= EntryEnd) {
4144  Entry = &PoolBigPageTable[0];
4145  }
4146  } while (Entry != EntryStart);
4147 
4148  //
4149  // Try to expand the tracker table.
4150  //
4151  // Since this involves copying the existing entries over and deleting
4152  // the old table, first acquire the lock exclusive.
4153  //
4154 
4155  if (ExTryAcquireSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock) == FALSE) {
4156  ExReleaseSpinLockShared (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
4157  continue;
4158  }
4159 
4160  //
4161  // No thread could have grown this during the contention above, so
4162  // ASSERT that this is the case.
4163  //
4164 
4165  ASSERT (TableSize == PoolBigPageTableSize);
4166 
4167  //
4168  // The expansion function always releases the lock.
4169  //
4170 
4171  if (ExpExpandBigPageTable (OldIrql) == FALSE) {
4172  ExpBigTableExpansionFailed += 1;
4173  return FALSE;
4174  }
4175 
4176  } while (TRUE);
4177 }
4178 
4179 
4180 ULONG
4181 ExpFindAndRemoveTagBigPages (
4182  IN PVOID Va,
4183  OUT PULONG BigPages,
4184  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType
4185  )
4186 
4187 /*++
4188 
4189 Routine Description:
4190 
4191  This function removes a pool tag from the big page tag table.
4192 
4193 Arguments:
4194 
4195  Va - Supplies the allocated virtual address.
4196 
4197  BigPages - Returns the number of pages that were allocated.
4198 
4199  PoolType - Supplies the type of the pool.
4200 
4201 Return Value:
4202 
4203  TRUE if an entry was found and removed, FALSE if not.
4204 
4205 Environment:
4206 
4207  No pool locks held so the table may be freely expanded here as needed.
4208 
4209 --*/
4210 
4211 { ULONG Hash;
4212  LOGICAL Inserted;
4213  SIZE_T TableSize;
4214  KIRQL OldIrql;
4215  ULONG ReturnKey;
4216  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES Entry;
4217 
4218  ASSERT (((ULONG_PTR)Va & POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE) == 0);
4219 
4220  if (PoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
4221  Hash = (ULONG)(((ULONG_PTR)Va) >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4222  Hash = ((Hash >> 24) ^ (Hash >> 16) ^ (Hash >> 8) ^ Hash);
4223  Hash &= ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableHash;
4224 
4225  ReturnKey = Hash;
4226 
4227  do {
4228  if (ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[Hash].Va == Va) {
4229 
4230  *BigPages = ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[Hash].NumberOfPages;
4231  ReturnKey = ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[Hash].Key;
4232 
4233  InterlockedOr ((PLONG) &ExpSessionPoolBigPageTable[Hash].Va,
4234  POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE);
4235 
4236  return ReturnKey;
4237  }
4238 
4239  Hash += 1;
4240  if (Hash >= ExpSessionPoolBigPageTableSize) {
4241  Hash = 0;
4242  }
4243  } while (Hash != ReturnKey);
4244 
4245  *BigPages = 0;
4246  return ' GIB';
4247  }
4248 
4249  Inserted = TRUE;
4250 
4251  Hash = (ULONG)(((ULONG_PTR)Va) >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4252  Hash = ((Hash >> 24) ^ (Hash >> 16) ^ (Hash >> 8) ^ Hash);
4253 
4254  OldIrql = ExAcquireSpinLockShared (&ExpLargePoolTableLock);
4255 
4256  Hash &= PoolBigPageTableHash;
4257 
4258  TableSize = PoolBigPageTableSize;
4259 
4260  while (PoolBigPageTable[Hash].Va != Va) {
4261  Hash += 1;
4262  if (Hash >= TableSize) {
4263 
4264  if (!Inserted) {
4265 
4266  ExReleaseSpinLockShared (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
4267 
4268  *BigPages = 0;
4269  return ' GIB';
4270  }
4271 
4272  Hash = 0;
4273  Inserted = FALSE;
4274  }
4275  }
4276 
4277  Entry = &PoolBigPageTable[Hash];
4278 
4279  *BigPages = Entry->NumberOfPages;
4280  ReturnKey = Entry->Key;
4281 
4282  InterlockedDecrement (&ExpPoolBigEntriesInUse);
4283 
4284 #if defined(_WIN64)
4285  InterlockedIncrement64 ((PLONGLONG) &Entry->Va);
4286 #else
4287  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG) &Entry->Va);
4288 #endif
4289 
4290  ExReleaseSpinLockShared (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
4291 
4292  return ReturnKey;
4293 }
4294 
4295 
4296 VOID
4297 ExFreePoolWithTag (
4298  __in PVOID P,
4299  __in ULONG TagToFree
4300  )
4301 
4302 /*++
4303 
4304 Routine Description:
4305 
4306  This function deallocates a block of pool. This function is used to
4307  deallocate to both the page aligned pools and the buddy (less than
4308  a page) pools.
4309 
4310  If the address of the block being deallocated is page-aligned, then
4311  the page-aligned pool deallocator is used.
4312 
4313  Otherwise, the binary buddy pool deallocator is used. Deallocation
4314  looks at the allocated block's pool header to determine the pool
4315  type and block size being deallocated. If the pool was allocated
4316  using ExAllocatePoolWithQuota, then after the deallocation is
4317  complete, the appropriate process's pool quota is adjusted to reflect
4318  the deallocation, and the process object is dereferenced.
4319 
4320 Arguments:
4321 
4322  P - Supplies the address of the block of pool being deallocated.
4323 
4324  TagToFree - Supplies the tag of the block being freed.
4325 
4326 Return Value:
4327 
4328  None.
4329 
4330 --*/
4331 
4332 {
4333  PVOID OldValue;
4334  POOL_TYPE CheckType;
4335  PPOOL_HEADER Entry;
4336  ULONG BlockSize;
4337  KLOCK_QUEUE_HANDLE LockHandle;
4338  PPOOL_HEADER NextEntry;
4339  POOL_TYPE PoolType;
4340  POOL_TYPE EntryPoolType;
4341  PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR PoolDesc;
4342  PEPROCESS ProcessBilled;
4343  LOGICAL Combined;
4344  ULONG BigPages;
4345  ULONG BigPages2;
4346  SIZE_T NumberOfBytes;
4347  ULONG Tag;
4348  PKPRCB Prcb;
4349  PGENERAL_LOOKASIDE LookasideList;
4350 
4351  PERFINFO_FREEPOOL(P);
4352 
4353  UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER (TagToFree);
4354 
4355  //
4356  // Initializing LockHandle is not needed for correctness but without
4357  // it the compiler cannot compile this code W4 to check for use of
4358  // uninitialized variables.
4359  //
4360 
4361  LockHandle.OldIrql = 0;
4362 
4363  if (ExpPoolFlags & (EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_TIMERS |
4364  EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_WORKERS |
4365  EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_RESOURCES |
4366  EX_KERNEL_VERIFIER_ENABLED |
4367  EX_VERIFIER_DEADLOCK_DETECTION_ENABLED |
4368  EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED)) {
4369 
4370  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) {
4371 
4372  //
4373  // Log all pool frees in this mode.
4374  //
4375 
4376  ULONG Hash;
4377  ULONG Index;
4378  LOGICAL SpecialPool;
4379  PEX_FREE_POOL_TRACES Information;
4380 
4381  SpecialPool = MmIsSpecialPoolAddress (P);
4382 
4383  if (ExFreePoolTraces != NULL) {
4384 
4385  Index = InterlockedIncrement (&ExFreePoolIndex);
4386  Index &= ExFreePoolMask;
4387  Information = &ExFreePoolTraces[Index];
4388 
4389  Information->Thread = PsGetCurrentThread ();
4390  Information->PoolAddress = P;
4391  if (SpecialPool == TRUE) {
4392  Information->PoolHeader = *(PPOOL_HEADER) PAGE_ALIGN (P);
4393  }
4394  else if (!PAGE_ALIGNED(P)) {
4395  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)P - POOL_OVERHEAD);
4396  Information->PoolHeader = *Entry;
4397  }
4398  else {
4399  RtlZeroMemory (&Information->PoolHeader,
4400  sizeof (POOL_HEADER));
4401  Information->PoolHeader.Ulong1 = MmGetSizeOfBigPoolAllocation (P);
4402  }
4403 
4404  RtlZeroMemory (&Information->StackTrace[0],
4405  EX_FREE_POOL_BACKTRACE_LENGTH * sizeof(PVOID));
4406 
4407  RtlCaptureStackBackTrace (1,
4408  EX_FREE_POOL_BACKTRACE_LENGTH,
4409  Information->StackTrace,
4410  &Hash);
4411  }
4412 
4413  if (SpecialPool == TRUE) {
4414 
4415  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_VERIFIER_DEADLOCK_DETECTION_ENABLED) {
4416  VerifierDeadlockFreePool (P, PAGE_SIZE);
4417  }
4418 
4419  MmFreeSpecialPool (P);
4420 
4421  return;
4422  }
4423  }
4424 
4425  if (!PAGE_ALIGNED(P)) {
4426 
4427  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)P - POOL_OVERHEAD);
4428 
4429  ASSERT_POOL_NOT_FREE(Entry);
4430 
4431  PoolType = (Entry->PoolType & POOL_TYPE_MASK) - 1;
4432 
4433  CheckType = PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK;
4434 
4435  ASSERT_FREE_IRQL(PoolType, P);
4436 
4437  ASSERT_POOL_TYPE_NOT_ZERO(Entry);
4438 
4439  if (!IS_POOL_HEADER_MARKED_ALLOCATED(Entry)) {
4440  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER,
4441  7,
4442  __LINE__,
4443  (ULONG_PTR)Entry->Ulong1,
4444  (ULONG_PTR)P);
4445  }
4446 
4447  //
4448  // Make sure the next pool header is consistent with respect to
4449  // the one being freed to ensure we at least catch pool corruptors
4450  // at the time of the free.
4451  //
4452  // It would be nice to also check the previous pool header as
4453  // if this is not consistent, it's likely the previous
4454  // allocation's owner is the corruptor and it's also likely he
4455  // has not yet freed the block either. However, this cannot
4456  // be done safely with mutex or lock synchronization
4457  // and this would be too high a performance penalty to pay.
4458  //
4459 
4460  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + Entry->BlockSize);
4461 
4462  if ((PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) &&
4463  (Entry->BlockSize != NextEntry->PreviousSize)) {
4464 
4465  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
4466  0x20,
4467  (ULONG_PTR) Entry,
4468  (ULONG_PTR) NextEntry,
4469  Entry->Ulong1);
4470  }
4471 
4472  NumberOfBytes = (SIZE_T)Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT;
4473 
4474  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_VERIFIER_DEADLOCK_DETECTION_ENABLED) {
4475  VerifierDeadlockFreePool (P, NumberOfBytes - POOL_OVERHEAD);
4476  }
4477 
4478  if (Entry->PoolType & POOL_VERIFIER_MASK) {
4479  VerifierFreeTrackedPool (P,
4480  NumberOfBytes,
4481  CheckType,
4482  FALSE);
4483  }
4484 
4485  //
4486  // Check if an ERESOURCE is currently active in this memory block.
4487  //
4488 
4489  FREE_CHECK_ERESOURCE (Entry, NumberOfBytes);
4490 
4491  //
4492  // Check if a KTIMER is currently active in this memory block.
4493  //
4494 
4495  FREE_CHECK_KTIMER (Entry, NumberOfBytes);
4496 
4497  //
4498  // Look for work items still queued.
4499  //
4500 
4501  FREE_CHECK_WORKER (Entry, NumberOfBytes);
4502  }
4503  }
4504 
4505  //
4506  // If the entry is page aligned, then free the block to the page aligned
4507  // pool. Otherwise, free the block to the allocation lists.
4508  //
4509 
4510  if (PAGE_ALIGNED(P)) {
4511 
4512  PoolType = MmDeterminePoolType (P);
4513 
4514  ASSERT_FREE_IRQL(PoolType, P);
4515 
4516  CheckType = PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK;
4517 
4518  if (PoolType == PagedPoolSession) {
4519  PoolDesc = ExpSessionPoolDescriptor;
4520  }
4521  else {
4522 
4523  PoolDesc = PoolVector[PoolType];
4524 
4525  if (CheckType == NonPagedPool) {
4526  if (MiIsPoolLargeSession (P) == TRUE) {
4527  PoolDesc = ExpSessionPoolDescriptor;
4528  PoolType = NonPagedPoolSession;
4529  }
4530  }
4531  }
4532 
4533  Tag = ExpFindAndRemoveTagBigPages (P, &BigPages, PoolType);
4534 
4535  if (BigPages == 0) {
4536 
4537  //
4538  // This means the allocator wasn't able to insert this
4539  // entry into the big page tag table. This allocation must
4540  // have been re-tagged as BIG at the time, our problem here
4541  // is that we don't know the size (or the real original tag).
4542  //
4543  // Ask Mm directly for the size.
4544  //
4545 
4546  BigPages = MmGetSizeOfBigPoolAllocation (P);
4547 
4548  ASSERT (BigPages != 0);
4549 
4550  ASSERT (Tag == ' GIB');
4551  }
4552  else if (Tag & PROTECTED_POOL) {
4553 
4554  Tag &= ~PROTECTED_POOL;
4555  }
4556 
4557  NumberOfBytes = (SIZE_T)BigPages << PAGE_SHIFT;
4558 
4559  ExpRemovePoolTracker (Tag, NumberOfBytes, PoolType);
4560 
4561  if (ExpPoolFlags & (EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_TIMERS |
4562  EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_WORKERS |
4563  EX_CHECK_POOL_FREES_FOR_ACTIVE_RESOURCES |
4564  EX_VERIFIER_DEADLOCK_DETECTION_ENABLED)) {
4565 
4566  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_VERIFIER_DEADLOCK_DETECTION_ENABLED) {
4567  VerifierDeadlockFreePool (P, NumberOfBytes);
4568  }
4569 
4570  //
4571  // Check if an ERESOURCE is currently active in this memory block.
4572  //
4573 
4574  FREE_CHECK_ERESOURCE (P, NumberOfBytes);
4575 
4576  //
4577  // Check if a KTIMER is currently active in this memory block.
4578  //
4579 
4580  FREE_CHECK_KTIMER (P, NumberOfBytes);
4581 
4582  //
4583  // Search worker queues for work items still queued.
4584  //
4585 
4586  FREE_CHECK_WORKER (P, NumberOfBytes);
4587  }
4588 
4589  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->RunningDeAllocs);
4590 
4591  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolDesc->TotalBytes, 0 - NumberOfBytes);
4592 
4593  BigPages2 = MiFreePoolPages (P);
4594 
4595  ASSERT (BigPages == BigPages2);
4596 
4597  InterlockedExchangeAdd ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->TotalBigPages, (LONG)(0 - BigPages2));
4598 
4599  return;
4600  }
4601 
4602  //
4603  // Align the entry address to a pool allocation boundary.
4604  //
4605 
4606  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)P - POOL_OVERHEAD);
4607 
4608  BlockSize = Entry->BlockSize;
4609 
4610  EntryPoolType = Entry->PoolType;
4611 
4612  PoolType = (Entry->PoolType & POOL_TYPE_MASK) - 1;
4613 
4614  CheckType = PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK;
4615 
4616  ASSERT_POOL_NOT_FREE (Entry);
4617 
4618  ASSERT_FREE_IRQL (PoolType, P);
4619 
4620  ASSERT_POOL_TYPE_NOT_ZERO (Entry);
4621 
4622  if (!IS_POOL_HEADER_MARKED_ALLOCATED(Entry)) {
4623  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_CALLER,
4624  7,
4625  __LINE__,
4626  (ULONG_PTR)Entry->Ulong1,
4627  (ULONG_PTR)P);
4628  }
4629 
4630  Tag = Entry->PoolTag;
4631  if (Tag & PROTECTED_POOL) {
4632  Tag &= ~PROTECTED_POOL;
4633  }
4634 
4635  //
4636  // Make sure the next pool header is consistent with respect to the
4637  // one being freed to ensure we at least catch pool corruptors at the
4638  // time of the free.
4639  //
4640  // It would be nice to also check the previous pool header as if this
4641  // is not consistent, it's likely the previous allocation's owner is the
4642  // corruptor and it's also likely he has not yet freed the block either.
4643  // However, this cannot be done safely with mutex or lock synchronization
4644  // and this would be too high a performance penalty to pay.
4645  //
4646 
4647  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + BlockSize);
4648 
4649  if ((PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) &&
4650  (BlockSize != NextEntry->PreviousSize)) {
4651 
4652  KeBugCheckEx (BAD_POOL_HEADER,
4653  0x20,
4654  (ULONG_PTR) Entry,
4655  (ULONG_PTR) NextEntry,
4656  Entry->Ulong1);
4657  }
4658 
4659  PoolDesc = PoolVector[CheckType];
4660 
4661  MARK_POOL_HEADER_FREED (Entry);
4662 
4663  if (EntryPoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) {
4664 
4665  if (CheckType == PagedPool) {
4666  PoolDesc = ExpSessionPoolDescriptor;
4667  }
4668  else if (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 1) {
4669  PoolDesc = ExpNonPagedPoolDescriptor[DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry)];
4670  }
4671 
4672  //
4673  // All session space allocations have an index of 0 unless there
4674  // are multiple nonpaged (session) pools.
4675  //
4676 
4677  ASSERT ((DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry) == 0) || (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 1));
4678  }
4679  else {
4680 
4681  if (CheckType == PagedPool) {
4682  ASSERT (DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry) <= ExpNumberOfPagedPools);
4683  PoolDesc = ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry)];
4684  }
4685  else {
4686  ASSERT ((DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry) == 0) || (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 1));
4687  if (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 1) {
4688  PoolDesc = ExpNonPagedPoolDescriptor[DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry)];
4689  }
4690  }
4691  }
4692 
4693  //
4694  // Update the pool tracking database.
4695  //
4696 
4697  ExpRemovePoolTrackerInline (Tag,
4698  BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT,
4699  EntryPoolType - 1);
4700 
4701  //
4702  // If quota was charged when the pool was allocated, release it now.
4703  //
4704 
4705  if (EntryPoolType & POOL_QUOTA_MASK) {
4706  ProcessBilled = ExpGetBilledProcess (Entry);
4707  if (ProcessBilled != NULL) {
4708  PsReturnPoolQuota (ProcessBilled,
4709  PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK,
4710  BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT);
4711 
4712  ObDereferenceObject (ProcessBilled);
4713 #if DBG
4714  InterlockedDecrement (&ExConcurrentQuotaPool);
4715 #endif
4716  }
4717  }
4718 
4719  //
4720  // If the pool block is a small block, then attempt to free the block
4721  // to the single entry lookaside list. If the free attempt fails, then
4722  // free the block by merging it back into the pool data structures.
4723  //
4724 
4725  if (((EntryPoolType & SESSION_POOL_MASK) == 0) ||
4726  (CheckType == NonPagedPool)) {
4727 
4728  if ((BlockSize <= POOL_SMALL_LISTS) && (USING_HOT_COLD_METRICS == 0)) {
4729 
4730  //
4731  // Try to free the small block to a per processor lookaside list.
4732  //
4733 
4734  Prcb = KeGetCurrentPrcb ();
4735 
4736  if (CheckType == PagedPool) {
4737 
4738  //
4739  // Prototype pool is never put on general lookaside lists
4740  // due to the sharecounts applied on these allocations when
4741  // they are in use (ie: the rest of this page is comprised of
4742  // prototype allocations even though this allocation is being
4743  // freed). Pages containing prototype allocations are much
4744  // more difficult for memory management to trim (unlike the
4745  // rest of paged pool) due to the sharecounts generally applied.
4746  //
4747 
4748  if (PoolDesc->PoolIndex == 0) {
4749  goto NoLookaside;
4750  }
4751 
4752  //
4753  // Only free the small block to the current processor's
4754  // lookaside list if the block is local to this node.
4755  //
4756 
4757  if (KeNumberNodes > 1) {
4758  if (Prcb->ParentNode->Color != PoolDesc->PoolIndex - 1) {
4759  goto NoLookaside;
4760  }
4761  }
4762 
4763  LookasideList = Prcb->PPPagedLookasideList[BlockSize - 1].P;
4764  LookasideList->TotalFrees += 1;
4765 
4766  if (ExQueryDepthSList(&LookasideList->ListHead) < LookasideList->Depth) {
4767  LookasideList->FreeHits += 1;
4768  InterlockedPushEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead,
4769  (PSLIST_ENTRY)P);
4770 
4771  return;
4772  }
4773 
4774  LookasideList = Prcb->PPPagedLookasideList[BlockSize - 1].L;
4775  LookasideList->TotalFrees += 1;
4776 
4777  if (ExQueryDepthSList(&LookasideList->ListHead) < LookasideList->Depth) {
4778  LookasideList->FreeHits += 1;
4779  InterlockedPushEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead,
4780  (PSLIST_ENTRY)P);
4781 
4782  return;
4783  }
4784 
4785  }
4786  else {
4787 
4788  //
4789  // Only free the small block to the current processor's
4790  // lookaside list if the block is local to this node.
4791  //
4792 
4793  if (KeNumberNodes > 1) {
4794  if (Prcb->ParentNode->Color != PoolDesc->PoolIndex) {
4795  goto NoLookaside;
4796  }
4797  }
4798 
4799  LookasideList = Prcb->PPNPagedLookasideList[BlockSize - 1].P;
4800  LookasideList->TotalFrees += 1;
4801 
4802  if (ExQueryDepthSList(&LookasideList->ListHead) < LookasideList->Depth) {
4803  LookasideList->FreeHits += 1;
4804  InterlockedPushEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead,
4805  (PSLIST_ENTRY)P);
4806 
4807  return;
4808 
4809  }
4810 
4811  LookasideList = Prcb->PPNPagedLookasideList[BlockSize - 1].L;
4812  LookasideList->TotalFrees += 1;
4813 
4814  if (ExQueryDepthSList(&LookasideList->ListHead) < LookasideList->Depth) {
4815  LookasideList->FreeHits += 1;
4816  InterlockedPushEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead,
4817  (PSLIST_ENTRY)P);
4818 
4819  return;
4820  }
4821  }
4822  }
4823  }
4824  else {
4825 
4826  if (BlockSize <= ExpSessionPoolSmallLists) {
4827 
4828  //
4829  // Attempt to free the small block to the session lookaside list.
4830  //
4831 
4832  LookasideList = (PGENERAL_LOOKASIDE)(ULONG_PTR)(ExpSessionPoolLookaside + BlockSize - 1);
4833 
4834  LookasideList->TotalFrees += 1;
4835 
4836  if (ExQueryDepthSList(&LookasideList->ListHead) < LookasideList->Depth) {
4837  LookasideList->FreeHits += 1;
4838  InterlockedPushEntrySList (&LookasideList->ListHead,
4839  (PSLIST_ENTRY)P);
4840 
4841  return;
4842  }
4843  }
4844  }
4845 
4846 NoLookaside:
4847 
4848  //
4849  // If the pool block release can be queued so the pool mutex/spinlock
4850  // acquisition/release can be amortized then do so. Note "hot" blocks
4851  // are generally in the lookasides above to provide fast reuse to take
4852  // advantage of hardware caching.
4853  //
4854 
4855  if (ExpPoolFlags & EX_DELAY_POOL_FREES) {
4856 
4857  if (PoolDesc->PendingFreeDepth >= EXP_MAXIMUM_POOL_FREES_PENDING) {
4858  ExDeferredFreePool (PoolDesc);
4859  }
4860 
4861  //
4862  // Push this entry on the deferred list.
4863  //
4864 
4865  do {
4866 
4867  OldValue = ReadForWriteAccess (&PoolDesc->PendingFrees);
4868  ((PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY)P)->Next = OldValue;
4869 
4870  } while (InterlockedCompareExchangePointer (
4871  &PoolDesc->PendingFrees,
4872  P,
4873  OldValue) != OldValue);
4874 
4875  InterlockedIncrement (&PoolDesc->PendingFreeDepth);
4876 
4877  return;
4878  }
4879 
4880  Combined = FALSE;
4881 
4882  ASSERT (BlockSize == Entry->BlockSize);
4883 
4884  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + BlockSize);
4885 
4886  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->RunningDeAllocs);
4887 
4888  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolDesc->TotalBytes, 0 - ((SIZE_T)BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT));
4889 
4890  LOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
4891 
4892  CHECK_POOL_PAGE (Entry);
4893 
4894  //
4895  // Free the specified pool block.
4896  //
4897  // Check to see if the next entry is free.
4898  //
4899 
4900  if (PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) {
4901 
4902  if (NextEntry->PoolType == 0) {
4903 
4904  //
4905  // This block is free, combine with the released block.
4906  //
4907 
4908  Combined = TRUE;
4909 
4910  //
4911  // If the split pool block contains only a header, then
4912  // it was not inserted and therefore cannot be removed.
4913  //
4914  // Note if the minimum pool block size is bigger than the
4915  // header then there can be no blocks like this.
4916  //
4917 
4918  if ((POOL_OVERHEAD != POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK) ||
4919  (NextEntry->BlockSize != 1)) {
4920 
4921  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
4922  PrivateRemoveEntryList(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
4923  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Flink));
4924  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Blink));
4925  }
4926 
4927  Entry->BlockSize = Entry->BlockSize + NextEntry->BlockSize;
4928  }
4929  }
4930 
4931  //
4932  // Check to see if the previous entry is free.
4933  //
4934 
4935  if (Entry->PreviousSize != 0) {
4936  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry - Entry->PreviousSize);
4937  if (NextEntry->PoolType == 0) {
4938 
4939  //
4940  // This block is free, combine with the released block.
4941  //
4942 
4943  Combined = TRUE;
4944 
4945  //
4946  // If the split pool block contains only a header, then
4947  // it was not inserted and therefore cannot be removed.
4948  //
4949  // Note if the minimum pool block size is bigger than the
4950  // header then there can be no blocks like this.
4951  //
4952 
4953  if ((POOL_OVERHEAD != POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK) ||
4954  (NextEntry->BlockSize != 1)) {
4955 
4956  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
4957  PrivateRemoveEntryList(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
4958  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Flink));
4959  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Blink));
4960  }
4961 
4962  NextEntry->BlockSize = NextEntry->BlockSize + Entry->BlockSize;
4963  Entry = NextEntry;
4964  }
4965  }
4966 
4967  //
4968  // If the block being freed has been combined into a full page,
4969  // then return the free page to memory management.
4970  //
4971 
4972  if (PAGE_ALIGNED(Entry) &&
4973  (PAGE_END((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + Entry->BlockSize) != FALSE)) {
4974 
4975  UNLOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
4976 
4977  InterlockedExchangeAdd ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->TotalPages, (LONG)-1);
4978 
4979  PERFINFO_FREEPOOLPAGE(CheckType, Entry->PoolIndex, Entry, PoolDesc);
4980 
4981  MiFreePoolPages (Entry);
4982  }
4983  else {
4984 
4985  //
4986  // Insert this element into the list.
4987  //
4988 
4989  Entry->PoolType = 0;
4990  BlockSize = Entry->BlockSize;
4991 
4992  ASSERT (BlockSize != 1);
4993 
4994  //
4995  // If the freed block was combined with any other block, then
4996  // adjust the size of the next block if necessary.
4997  //
4998 
4999  if (Combined != FALSE) {
5000 
5001  //
5002  // The size of this entry has changed, if this entry is
5003  // not the last one in the page, update the pool block
5004  // after this block to have a new previous allocation size.
5005  //
5006 
5007  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + BlockSize);
5008  if (PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) {
5009  NextEntry->PreviousSize = (USHORT) BlockSize;
5010  }
5011  }
5012 
5013  //
5014  // Always insert at the head in hopes of reusing cache lines.
5015  //
5016 
5017  PrivateInsertHeadList (&PoolDesc->ListHeads[BlockSize - 1],
5018  ((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)Entry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5019 
5020  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)Entry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5021 
5022  UNLOCK_POOL(PoolDesc, LockHandle);
5023  }
5024 }
5025 
5026 VOID
5027 ExFreePool (
5028  __in PVOID P
5029  )
5030 {
5031  ExFreePoolWithTag (P, 0);
5032  return;
5033 }
5034 
5035 
5036 VOID
5037 ExDeferredFreePool (
5038  IN PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR PoolDesc
5039  )
5040 
5041 /*++
5042 
5043 Routine Description:
5044 
5045  This routine frees a number of pool allocations at once to amortize the
5046  synchronization overhead cost.
5047 
5048 Arguments:
5049 
5050  PoolDesc - Supplies the relevant pool descriptor.
5051 
5052 Return Value:
5053 
5054  None.
5055 
5056 Environment:
5057 
5058  Kernel mode. May be as high as APC_LEVEL for paged pool or DISPATCH_LEVEL
5059  for nonpaged pool.
5060 
5061 --*/
5062 
5063 {
5064  LONG ListCount;
5065  KLOCK_QUEUE_HANDLE LockHandle;
5066  POOL_TYPE CheckType;
5067  PPOOL_HEADER Entry;
5068  ULONG Index;
5069  ULONG WholePageCount;
5070  PPOOL_HEADER NextEntry;
5071  ULONG PoolIndex;
5072  LOGICAL Combined;
5073  PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY SingleListEntry;
5074  PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY NextSingleListEntry;
5075  PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY FirstEntry;
5076  PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY LastEntry;
5077  PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY WholePages;
5078 
5079  CheckType = PoolDesc->PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK;
5080 
5081  //
5082  // Initializing LockHandle is not needed for correctness but without
5083  // it the compiler cannot compile this code W4 to check for use of
5084  // uninitialized variables.
5085  //
5086 
5087  LockHandle.OldIrql = 0;
5088 
5089  ListCount = 0;
5090  WholePages = NULL;
5091  WholePageCount = 0;
5092  LastEntry = NULL;
5093 
5094  LOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
5095 
5096  if (PoolDesc->PendingFrees == NULL) {
5097  UNLOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
5098  return;
5099  }
5100 
5101  //
5102  // Free each deferred pool entry until they're all done.
5103  //
5104 
5105  do {
5106 
5107  SingleListEntry = PoolDesc->PendingFrees;
5108 
5109  FirstEntry = SingleListEntry;
5110 
5111  do {
5112 
5113  NextSingleListEntry = SingleListEntry->Next;
5114 
5115  //
5116  // Process the deferred entry.
5117  //
5118 
5119  ListCount += 1;
5120 
5121  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)SingleListEntry - POOL_OVERHEAD);
5122 
5123  PoolIndex = DECODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry);
5124 
5125  //
5126  // Process the block.
5127  //
5128 
5129  Combined = FALSE;
5130 
5131  CHECK_POOL_PAGE (Entry);
5132 
5133  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->RunningDeAllocs);
5134 
5135  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&PoolDesc->TotalBytes,
5136  0 - ((SIZE_T)Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT));
5137 
5138  //
5139  // Free the specified pool block.
5140  //
5141  // Check to see if the next entry is free.
5142  //
5143 
5144  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + Entry->BlockSize);
5145  if (PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) {
5146 
5147  if (NextEntry->PoolType == 0) {
5148 
5149  //
5150  // This block is free, combine with the released block.
5151  //
5152 
5153  Combined = TRUE;
5154 
5155  //
5156  // If the split pool block contains only a header, then
5157  // it was not inserted and therefore cannot be removed.
5158  //
5159  // Note if the minimum pool block size is bigger than the
5160  // header then there can be no blocks like this.
5161  //
5162 
5163  if ((POOL_OVERHEAD != POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK) ||
5164  (NextEntry->BlockSize != 1)) {
5165 
5166  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5167  PrivateRemoveEntryList(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5168  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Flink));
5169  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Blink));
5170  }
5171 
5172  Entry->BlockSize = Entry->BlockSize + NextEntry->BlockSize;
5173  }
5174  }
5175 
5176  //
5177  // Check to see if the previous entry is free.
5178  //
5179 
5180  if (Entry->PreviousSize != 0) {
5181  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry - Entry->PreviousSize);
5182  if (NextEntry->PoolType == 0) {
5183 
5184  //
5185  // This block is free, combine with the released block.
5186  //
5187 
5188  Combined = TRUE;
5189 
5190  //
5191  // If the split pool block contains only a header, then
5192  // it was not inserted and therefore cannot be removed.
5193  //
5194  // Note if the minimum pool block size is bigger than the
5195  // header then there can be no blocks like this.
5196  //
5197 
5198  if ((POOL_OVERHEAD != POOL_SMALLEST_BLOCK) ||
5199  (NextEntry->BlockSize != 1)) {
5200 
5201  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5202  PrivateRemoveEntryList(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5203  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Flink));
5204  CHECK_LIST(DecodeLink(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)NextEntry + POOL_OVERHEAD))->Blink));
5205  }
5206 
5207  NextEntry->BlockSize = NextEntry->BlockSize + Entry->BlockSize;
5208  Entry = NextEntry;
5209  }
5210  }
5211 
5212  //
5213  // If the block being freed has been combined into a full page,
5214  // then return the free page to memory management.
5215  //
5216 
5217  if (PAGE_ALIGNED(Entry) &&
5218  (PAGE_END((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + Entry->BlockSize) != FALSE)) {
5219 
5220  ((PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY)Entry)->Next = WholePages;
5221  WholePages = (PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY) Entry;
5222  WholePageCount += 1;
5223  }
5224  else {
5225 
5226  //
5227  // Insert this element into the list.
5228  //
5229 
5230  Entry->PoolType = 0;
5231  ENCODE_POOL_INDEX(Entry, PoolIndex);
5232  Index = Entry->BlockSize;
5233 
5234  ASSERT (Index != 1);
5235 
5236  //
5237  // If the freed block was combined with any other block, then
5238  // adjust the size of the next block if necessary.
5239  //
5240 
5241  if (Combined != FALSE) {
5242 
5243  //
5244  // The size of this entry has changed, if this entry is
5245  // not the last one in the page, update the pool block
5246  // after this block to have a new previous allocation size.
5247  //
5248 
5249  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PPOOL_BLOCK)Entry + Index);
5250  if (PAGE_END(NextEntry) == FALSE) {
5251  NextEntry->PreviousSize = (USHORT) Index;
5252  }
5253  }
5254 
5255  //
5256  // Always insert at the head in hopes of reusing cache lines.
5257  //
5258 
5259  PrivateInsertHeadList(&PoolDesc->ListHeads[Index - 1], ((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)Entry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5260 
5261  CHECK_LIST(((PLIST_ENTRY)((PCHAR)Entry + POOL_OVERHEAD)));
5262  }
5263 
5264  //
5265  // March on to the next entry if there is one.
5266  //
5267 
5268  if (NextSingleListEntry == LastEntry) {
5269  break;
5270  }
5271 
5272  SingleListEntry = NextSingleListEntry;
5273 
5274  } while (TRUE);
5275 
5276  if (InterlockedCompareExchangePointer (&PoolDesc->PendingFrees,
5277  NULL,
5278  FirstEntry) == FirstEntry) {
5279  break;
5280  }
5281  LastEntry = FirstEntry;
5282 
5283  } while (TRUE);
5284 
5285  UNLOCK_POOL (PoolDesc, LockHandle);
5286 
5287  if (WholePages != NULL) {
5288 
5289  //
5290  // If the pool type is paged pool, then the global paged pool mutex
5291  // must be held during the free of the pool pages. Hence any
5292  // full pages were batched up and are now dealt with in one go.
5293  //
5294 
5295  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER) WholePages;
5296 
5297  InterlockedExchangeAdd ((PLONG)&PoolDesc->TotalPages, 0 - WholePageCount);
5298  do {
5299 
5300  NextEntry = (PPOOL_HEADER) (((PSINGLE_LIST_ENTRY)Entry)->Next);
5301 
5302  PERFINFO_FREEPOOLPAGE(CheckType, PoolIndex, Entry, PoolDesc);
5303 
5304  MiFreePoolPages (Entry);
5305 
5306  Entry = NextEntry;
5307 
5308  } while (Entry != NULL);
5309  }
5310 
5311  InterlockedExchangeAdd (&PoolDesc->PendingFreeDepth, (0 - ListCount));
5312 
5313  return;
5314 }
5315 
5316 SIZE_T
5317 ExQueryPoolBlockSize (
5318  __in PVOID PoolBlock,
5319  __out PBOOLEAN QuotaCharged
5320  )
5321 
5322 /*++
5323 
5324 Routine Description:
5325 
5326  This function returns the size of the pool block.
5327 
5328 Arguments:
5329 
5330  PoolBlock - Supplies the address of the block of pool.
5331 
5332  QuotaCharged - Supplies a BOOLEAN variable to receive whether or not the
5333  pool block had quota charged.
5334 
5335  NOTE: If the entry is bigger than a page, the value PAGE_SIZE is returned
5336  rather than the correct number of bytes.
5337 
5338 Return Value:
5339 
5340  Size of pool block.
5341 
5342 --*/
5343 
5344 {
5345  PPOOL_HEADER Entry;
5346  SIZE_T size;
5347 
5348  if ((ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) &&
5349  (MmIsSpecialPoolAddress (PoolBlock))) {
5350  *QuotaCharged = FALSE;
5351  return MmQuerySpecialPoolBlockSize (PoolBlock);
5352  }
5353 
5354  if (PAGE_ALIGNED(PoolBlock)) {
5355  *QuotaCharged = FALSE;
5356  return PAGE_SIZE;
5357  }
5358 
5359  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)PoolBlock - POOL_OVERHEAD);
5360  size = (ULONG)((Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT) - POOL_OVERHEAD);
5361 
5362  if (ExpGetBilledProcess (Entry)) {
5363  *QuotaCharged = TRUE;
5364  }
5365  else {
5366  *QuotaCharged = FALSE;
5367  }
5368 
5369  return size;
5370 }
5371 
5372 VOID
5373 ExQueryPoolUsage (
5374  __out PULONG PagedPoolPages,
5375  __out PULONG NonPagedPoolPages,
5376  __out PULONG PagedPoolAllocs,
5377  __out PULONG PagedPoolFrees,
5378  __out PULONG PagedPoolLookasideHits,
5379  __out PULONG NonPagedPoolAllocs,
5380  __out PULONG NonPagedPoolFrees,
5381  __out PULONG NonPagedPoolLookasideHits
5382  )
5383 
5384 {
5385  ULONG Index;
5386  PGENERAL_LOOKASIDE Lookaside;
5387  PLIST_ENTRY NextEntry;
5388  PPOOL_DESCRIPTOR pd;
5389 
5390  //
5391  // Sum all the paged pool usage.
5392  //
5393 
5394  *PagedPoolPages = 0;
5395  *PagedPoolAllocs = 0;
5396  *PagedPoolFrees = 0;
5397 
5398  for (Index = 0; Index < ExpNumberOfPagedPools + 1; Index += 1) {
5399  pd = ExpPagedPoolDescriptor[Index];
5400  *PagedPoolPages += pd->TotalPages + pd->TotalBigPages;
5401  *PagedPoolAllocs += pd->RunningAllocs;
5402  *PagedPoolFrees += pd->RunningDeAllocs;
5403  }
5404 
5405  //
5406  // Sum all the nonpaged pool usage.
5407  //
5408 
5409  pd = &NonPagedPoolDescriptor;
5410  *NonPagedPoolPages = pd->TotalPages + pd->TotalBigPages;
5411  *NonPagedPoolAllocs = pd->RunningAllocs;
5412  *NonPagedPoolFrees = pd->RunningDeAllocs;
5413 
5414  if (ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools > 1) {
5415  for (Index = 0; Index < ExpNumberOfNonPagedPools; Index += 1) {
5416  pd = ExpNonPagedPoolDescriptor[Index];
5417  *NonPagedPoolPages += pd->TotalPages + pd->TotalBigPages;
5418  *NonPagedPoolAllocs += pd->RunningAllocs;
5419  *NonPagedPoolFrees += pd->RunningDeAllocs;
5420  }
5421  }
5422 
5423  //
5424  // Sum all the lookaside hits for paged and nonpaged pool.
5425  //
5426 
5427  NextEntry = ExPoolLookasideListHead.Flink;
5428  while (NextEntry != &ExPoolLookasideListHead) {
5429  Lookaside = CONTAINING_RECORD(NextEntry,
5430  GENERAL_LOOKASIDE,
5431  ListEntry);
5432 
5433  if (Lookaside->Type == NonPagedPool) {
5434  *NonPagedPoolLookasideHits += Lookaside->AllocateHits;
5435 
5436  }
5437  else {
5438  *PagedPoolLookasideHits += Lookaside->AllocateHits;
5439  }
5440 
5441  NextEntry = NextEntry->Flink;
5442  }
5443 
5444  return;
5445 }
5446 
5447 
5448 VOID
5449 ExReturnPoolQuota (
5450  IN PVOID P
5451  )
5452 
5453 /*++
5454 
5455 Routine Description:
5456 
5457  This function returns quota charged to a subject process when the
5458  specified pool block was allocated.
5459 
5460 Arguments:
5461 
5462  P - Supplies the address of the block of pool being deallocated.
5463 
5464 Return Value:
5465 
5466  None.
5467 
5468 --*/
5469 
5470 {
5471 
5472  PPOOL_HEADER Entry;
5473  POOL_TYPE PoolType;
5474  PEPROCESS ProcessBilled;
5475 
5476  //
5477  // Do nothing for special pool. No quota was charged.
5478  //
5479 
5480  if ((ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) &&
5481  (MmIsSpecialPoolAddress (P))) {
5482  return;
5483  }
5484 
5485  //
5486  // Align the entry address to a pool allocation boundary.
5487  //
5488 
5489  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)P - POOL_OVERHEAD);
5490 
5491  //
5492  // If quota was charged, then return the appropriate quota to the
5493  // subject process.
5494  //
5495 
5496  if (Entry->PoolType & POOL_QUOTA_MASK) {
5497 
5498  PoolType = (Entry->PoolType & POOL_TYPE_MASK) - 1;
5499 
5500  ProcessBilled = ExpGetBilledProcess (Entry);
5501 
5502  if (ProcessBilled == NULL) {
5503  return;
5504  }
5505 
5506 #if defined (_WIN64)
5507 
5508  //
5509  // This flag cannot be cleared in NT32 because it's used to denote the
5510  // allocation is larger (and the verifier finds its own header
5511  // based on this).
5512  //
5513 
5514  Entry->PoolType &= ~POOL_QUOTA_MASK;
5515 
5516 #else
5517 
5518  //
5519  // Instead of clearing the flag above, zero the quota pointer.
5520  //
5521 
5522  * (PVOID *)((PCHAR)Entry + (Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT) - sizeof (PVOID)) = NULL;
5523 
5524 #endif
5525 
5526  PsReturnPoolQuota (ProcessBilled,
5527  PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK,
5528  (ULONG)Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT);
5529 
5530  ObDereferenceObject (ProcessBilled);
5531 #if DBG
5532  InterlockedDecrement (&ExConcurrentQuotaPool);
5533 #endif
5534  }
5535 
5536  return;
5537 }
5538 
5539 #if !defined (NT_UP)
5540 
5541 PVOID
5542 ExCreatePoolTagTable (
5543  IN ULONG NewProcessorNumber,
5544  IN UCHAR NodeNumber
5545  )
5546 {
5547  SIZE_T NumberOfBytes;
5548  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE NewTagTable;
5549 
5550  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql () == PASSIVE_LEVEL);
5551  ASSERT (NewProcessorNumber < MAXIMUM_PROCESSOR_TAG_TABLES);
5552  ASSERT (ExPoolTagTables[NewProcessorNumber] == NULL);
5553 
5554  NumberOfBytes = (PoolTrackTableSize + 1) * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE);
5555 
5556  NewTagTable = MmAllocateIndependentPages (NumberOfBytes, NodeNumber);
5557 
5558  if (NewTagTable != NULL) {
5559 
5560  //
5561  // Just zero the table here, the tags are lazy filled as various pool
5562  // allocations and frees occur. Note no memory barrier is needed
5563  // because only this processor will read it except when an
5564  // ExGetPoolTagInfo call occurs, and in that case, explicit memory
5565  // barriers are used as needed.
5566  //
5567 
5568  RtlZeroMemory (NewTagTable,
5569  PoolTrackTableSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE));
5570 
5571  ExPoolTagTables[NewProcessorNumber] = NewTagTable;
5572  }
5573 
5574  return (PVOID) NewTagTable;
5575 }
5576 
5577 VOID
5578 ExDeletePoolTagTable (
5579  IN ULONG NewProcessorNumber
5580  )
5581 
5582 /*++
5583 
5584 Routine Description:
5585 
5586  This function deletes the tag table for the specified processor
5587  number because the processor did not boot.
5588 
5589 Arguments:
5590 
5591  NewProcessorNumber - Supplies the processor number that did not boot.
5592 
5593 Return Value:
5594 
5595  None.
5596 
5597 --*/
5598 
5599 {
5600  KIRQL OldIrql;
5601  PVOID VirtualAddress;
5602  SIZE_T NumberOfBytes;
5603 
5604  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql () == PASSIVE_LEVEL);
5605  ASSERT (NewProcessorNumber < MAXIMUM_PROCESSOR_TAG_TABLES);
5606  ASSERT (ExPoolTagTables[NewProcessorNumber] != NULL);
5607 
5608  NumberOfBytes = (PoolTrackTableSize + 1) * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE);
5609 
5610  VirtualAddress = ExPoolTagTables[NewProcessorNumber];
5611 
5612  //
5613  // Raise to DISPATCH to prevent a race when attempting to hot-add a
5614  // processor while a pool-usage query is active.
5615  //
5616 
5617  KeRaiseIrql (DISPATCH_LEVEL, &OldIrql);
5618 
5619  ExPoolTagTables[NewProcessorNumber] = NULL;
5620 
5621  KeLowerIrql (OldIrql);
5622 
5623  MmFreeIndependentPages (VirtualAddress, NumberOfBytes);
5624 
5625  return;
5626 }
5627 #endif
