5629 typedef struct _POOL_DPC_CONTEXT {
5630 
5631  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE PoolTrackTable;
5632  SIZE_T PoolTrackTableSize;
5633 
5634  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE PoolTrackTableExpansion;
5635  SIZE_T PoolTrackTableSizeExpansion;
5636 
5637 } POOL_DPC_CONTEXT, *PPOOL_DPC_CONTEXT;
5638 
5639 VOID
5640 ExpGetPoolTagInfoTarget (
5641  IN PKDPC Dpc,
5642  IN PVOID DeferredContext,
5643  IN PVOID SystemArgument1,
5644  IN PVOID SystemArgument2
5645  )
5646 /*++
5647 
5648 Routine Description:
5649 
5650  Called by all processors during a pool tag table query.
5651 
5652 Arguments:
5653 
5654  Dpc - Supplies a pointer to a control object of type DPC.
5655 
5656  DeferredContext - Deferred context.
5657 
5658  SystemArgument1 - Used to signal completion of this call.
5659 
5660  SystemArgument2 - Used for internal lockstepping during this call.
5661 
5662 Return Value:
5663 
5664  None.
5665 
5666 Environment:
5667 
5668  DISPATCH_LEVEL since this is called from a DPC.
5669 
5670 --*/
5671 {
5672  PPOOL_DPC_CONTEXT Context;
5673 #if !defined (NT_UP)
5674  ULONG i;
5675  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackerEntry;
5676  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE LastTrackerEntry;
5677  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TargetTrackerEntry;
5678 #endif
5679 
5680  UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER (Dpc);
5681 
5682  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql () == DISPATCH_LEVEL);
5683 
5684  Context = DeferredContext;
5685 
5686  //
5687  // Make sure all DPCs are running (ie: spinning at DISPATCH_LEVEL)
5688  // to prevent any pool allocations or frees from happening until
5689  // all the counters are snapped. Otherwise the counters could
5690  // be misleading (ie: more frees than allocs, etc).
5691  //
5692 
5693  if (KeSignalCallDpcSynchronize (SystemArgument2)) {
5694 
5695  //
5696  // This processor (could be the caller or a target) is the final
5697  // processor to enter the DPC spinloop. Snap the data now.
5698  //
5699 
5700 #if defined (NT_UP)
5701 
5702  RtlCopyMemory ((PVOID)Context->PoolTrackTable,
5703  (PVOID)PoolTrackTable,
5704  Context->PoolTrackTableSize * sizeof (POOL_TRACKER_TABLE));
5705 
5706 #else
5707 
5708  RtlCopyMemory ((PVOID)Context->PoolTrackTable,
5709  (PVOID)ExPoolTagTables[0],
5710  Context->PoolTrackTableSize * sizeof (POOL_TRACKER_TABLE));
5711 
5712  LastTrackerEntry = Context->PoolTrackTable + Context->PoolTrackTableSize;
5713 
5714  for (i = 1; i < MAXIMUM_PROCESSOR_TAG_TABLES; i += 1) {
5715 
5716  TargetTrackerEntry = ExPoolTagTables[i];
5717 
5718  if (TargetTrackerEntry == NULL) {
5719  continue;
5720  }
5721 
5722  TrackerEntry = Context->PoolTrackTable;
5723 
5724  while (TrackerEntry != LastTrackerEntry) {
5725 
5726  if (TargetTrackerEntry->Key != 0) {
5727 
5728  ASSERT (TargetTrackerEntry->Key == TrackerEntry->Key);
5729 
5730  TrackerEntry->NonPagedAllocs += TargetTrackerEntry->NonPagedAllocs;
5731  TrackerEntry->NonPagedFrees += TargetTrackerEntry->NonPagedFrees;
5732  TrackerEntry->NonPagedBytes += TargetTrackerEntry->NonPagedBytes;
5733  TrackerEntry->PagedAllocs += TargetTrackerEntry->PagedAllocs;
5734  TrackerEntry->PagedFrees += TargetTrackerEntry->PagedFrees;
5735  TrackerEntry->PagedBytes += TargetTrackerEntry->PagedBytes;
5736  }
5737  TrackerEntry += 1;
5738  TargetTrackerEntry += 1;
5739  }
5740  }
5741 
5742 #endif
5743 
5744  if (Context->PoolTrackTableSizeExpansion != 0) {
5745  RtlCopyMemory ((PVOID)(Context->PoolTrackTableExpansion),
5746  (PVOID)PoolTrackTableExpansion,
5747  Context->PoolTrackTableSizeExpansion * sizeof (POOL_TRACKER_TABLE));
5748  }
5749  }
5750 
5751  //
5752  // Wait until everyone has got to this point before continuing.
5753  //
5754 
5755  KeSignalCallDpcSynchronize (SystemArgument2);
5756 
5757  //
5758  // Signal that all processing has been done.
5759  //
5760 
5761  KeSignalCallDpcDone (SystemArgument1);
5762 
5763  return;
5764 }
5765 
5766 NTSTATUS
5767 ExGetPoolTagInfo (
5768  IN PVOID SystemInformation,
5769  IN ULONG SystemInformationLength,
5770  IN OUT PULONG ReturnLength OPTIONAL
5771  )
5772 
5773 /*++
5774 
5775 Routine Description:
5776 
5777  This function copies the system pool tag information to the supplied
5778  USER space buffer. Note that the caller has already probed the USER
5779  address and wrapped this routine inside a try-except.
5780 
5781 Arguments:
5782 
5783  SystemInformation - Supplies a user space buffer to copy the data to.
5784 
5785  SystemInformationLength - Supplies the length of the user buffer.
5786 
5787  ReturnLength - Receives the actual length of the data returned.
5788 
5789 Return Value:
5790 
5791  Various NTSTATUS codes.
5792 
5793 --*/
5794 
5795 {
5796  SIZE_T NumberOfBytes;
5797  SIZE_T NumberOfExpansionTableBytes;
5798  ULONG totalBytes;
5799  NTSTATUS status;
5800  PSYSTEM_POOLTAG_INFORMATION taginfo;
5801  PSYSTEM_POOLTAG poolTag;
5802  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE PoolTrackInfo;
5803  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackerEntry;
5804  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE LastTrackerEntry;
5805  POOL_DPC_CONTEXT Context;
5806  SIZE_T LocalTrackTableSize;
5807  SIZE_T LocalTrackTableSizeExpansion;
5808 
5809  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql () == PASSIVE_LEVEL);
5810 
5811  totalBytes = 0;
5812  status = STATUS_SUCCESS;
5813 
5814  taginfo = (PSYSTEM_POOLTAG_INFORMATION)SystemInformation;
5815  poolTag = &taginfo->TagInfo[0];
5816  totalBytes = FIELD_OFFSET(SYSTEM_POOLTAG_INFORMATION, TagInfo);
5817  taginfo->Count = 0;
5818 
5819  LocalTrackTableSize = PoolTrackTableSize;
5820  LocalTrackTableSizeExpansion = PoolTrackTableExpansionSize;
5821 
5822  NumberOfBytes = LocalTrackTableSize * sizeof(POOL_TRACKER_TABLE);
5823  NumberOfExpansionTableBytes = LocalTrackTableSizeExpansion * sizeof (POOL_TRACKER_TABLE);
5824 
5825  PoolTrackInfo = (PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE) ExAllocatePoolWithTag (
5826  NonPagedPool,
5827  NumberOfBytes + NumberOfExpansionTableBytes,
5828  'ofnI');
5829 
5830  if (PoolTrackInfo == NULL) {
5831  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
5832  }
5833 
5834  Context.PoolTrackTable = PoolTrackInfo;
5835  Context.PoolTrackTableSize = PoolTrackTableSize;
5836 
5837  Context.PoolTrackTableExpansion = (PoolTrackInfo + PoolTrackTableSize);
5838  Context.PoolTrackTableSizeExpansion = PoolTrackTableExpansionSize;
5839 
5840  KeGenericCallDpc (ExpGetPoolTagInfoTarget, &Context);
5841 
5842  TrackerEntry = PoolTrackInfo;
5843  LastTrackerEntry = PoolTrackInfo + (LocalTrackTableSize + LocalTrackTableSizeExpansion);
5844 
5845  //
5846  // Wrap the user space accesses with an exception handler so we can free the
5847  // pool track info allocation if the user address was bogus.
5848  //
5849 
5850  try {
5851  while (TrackerEntry < LastTrackerEntry) {
5852  if (TrackerEntry->Key != 0) {
5853  taginfo->Count += 1;
5854  totalBytes += sizeof (SYSTEM_POOLTAG);
5855  if (SystemInformationLength < totalBytes) {
5856  status = STATUS_INFO_LENGTH_MISMATCH;
5857  }
5858  else {
5859  ASSERT (TrackerEntry->PagedAllocs >= TrackerEntry->PagedFrees);
5860  ASSERT (TrackerEntry->NonPagedAllocs >= TrackerEntry->NonPagedFrees);
5861 
5862  poolTag->TagUlong = TrackerEntry->Key;
5863  poolTag->PagedAllocs = TrackerEntry->PagedAllocs;
5864  poolTag->PagedFrees = TrackerEntry->PagedFrees;
5865  poolTag->PagedUsed = TrackerEntry->PagedBytes;
5866  poolTag->NonPagedAllocs = TrackerEntry->NonPagedAllocs;
5867  poolTag->NonPagedFrees = TrackerEntry->NonPagedFrees;
5868  poolTag->NonPagedUsed = TrackerEntry->NonPagedBytes;
5869  poolTag += 1;
5870  }
5871  }
5872  TrackerEntry += 1;
5873  }
5874  }
5875  except (EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER) {
5876  status = GetExceptionCode ();
5877  }
5878 
5879  ExFreePool (PoolTrackInfo);
5880 
5881  if (ARGUMENT_PRESENT(ReturnLength)) {
5882  *ReturnLength = totalBytes;
5883  }
5884 
5885  return status;
5886 }
5887 
5888 NTSTATUS
5889 ExGetSessionPoolTagInfo (
5890  IN PVOID SystemInformation,
5891  IN ULONG SystemInformationLength,
5892  IN OUT PULONG ReturnedEntries,
5893  IN OUT PULONG ActualEntries
5894  )
5895 
5896 /*++
5897 
5898 Routine Description:
5899 
5900  This function copies the current session's pool tag information to the
5901  supplied system-mapped buffer.
5902 
5903 Arguments:
5904 
5905  SystemInformation - Supplies a system mapped buffer to copy the data to.
5906 
5907  SystemInformationLength - Supplies the length of the buffer.
5908 
5909  ReturnedEntries - Receives the actual number of entries returned.
5910 
5911  ActualEntries - Receives the total number of entries.
5912  This can be more than ReturnedEntries if the caller's
5913  buffer is not large enough to hold all the data.
5914 
5915 Return Value:
5916 
5917  Various NTSTATUS codes.
5918 
5919 --*/
5920 
5921 {
5922  ULONG totalBytes;
5923  ULONG ActualCount;
5924  ULONG ReturnedCount;
5925  NTSTATUS status;
5926  PSYSTEM_POOLTAG poolTag;
5927  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE TrackerEntry;
5928  PPOOL_TRACKER_TABLE LastTrackerEntry;
5929 
5930  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql () == PASSIVE_LEVEL);
5931 
5932  totalBytes = 0;
5933  ActualCount = 0;
5934  ReturnedCount = 0;
5935  status = STATUS_SUCCESS;
5936 
5937  poolTag = (PSYSTEM_POOLTAG) SystemInformation;
5938 
5939  //
5940  // Capture the current session's pool information.
5941  //
5942 
5943  TrackerEntry = ExpSessionPoolTrackTable;
5944  LastTrackerEntry = TrackerEntry + ExpSessionPoolTrackTableSize;
5945 
5946  while (TrackerEntry < LastTrackerEntry) {
5947  if (TrackerEntry->Key != 0) {
5948  ActualCount += 1;
5949  totalBytes += sizeof (SYSTEM_POOLTAG);
5950 
5951  if (totalBytes > SystemInformationLength) {
5952  status = STATUS_INFO_LENGTH_MISMATCH;
5953  }
5954  else {
5955  ReturnedCount += 1;
5956 
5957  poolTag->TagUlong = TrackerEntry->Key;
5958  poolTag->PagedAllocs = TrackerEntry->PagedAllocs;
5959  poolTag->PagedFrees = TrackerEntry->PagedFrees;
5960  poolTag->PagedUsed = TrackerEntry->PagedBytes;
5961  poolTag->NonPagedAllocs = TrackerEntry->NonPagedAllocs;
5962  poolTag->NonPagedFrees = TrackerEntry->NonPagedFrees;
5963  poolTag->NonPagedUsed = TrackerEntry->NonPagedBytes;
5964 
5965  //
5966  // Session pool tag entries are updated with interlocked
5967  // sequences so it is possible here that we can read one
5968  // that is in the middle of being updated. Sanitize the
5969  // data here so callers don't have to.
5970  //
5971 
5972  ASSERT ((SSIZE_T)poolTag->PagedUsed >= 0);
5973  ASSERT ((SSIZE_T)poolTag->NonPagedUsed >= 0);
5974 
5975  if (poolTag->PagedAllocs < poolTag->PagedFrees) {
5976  poolTag->PagedAllocs = poolTag->PagedFrees;
5977  }
5978 
5979  if (poolTag->NonPagedAllocs < poolTag->NonPagedFrees) {
5980  poolTag->NonPagedAllocs = poolTag->NonPagedFrees;
5981  }
5982 
5983  poolTag += 1;
5984  }
5985  }
5986  TrackerEntry += 1;
5987  }
5988 
5989  *ReturnedEntries = ReturnedCount;
5990  *ActualEntries = ActualCount;
5991 
5992  return status;
5993 }
5994 
5995 NTSTATUS
5996 ExGetBigPoolInfo (
5997  IN PVOID SystemInformation,
5998  IN ULONG SystemInformationLength,
5999  IN OUT PULONG ReturnLength OPTIONAL
6000  )
6001 
6002 /*++
6003 
6004 Routine Description:
6005 
6006  This function copies the system big pool entry information to the supplied
6007  USER space buffer. Note that the caller has already probed the USER
6008  address and wrapped this routine inside a try-except.
6009 
6010  PAGELK was not used for this function so that calling it causes minimal
6011  disruption to actual memory usage.
6012 
6013 Arguments:
6014 
6015  SystemInformation - Supplies a user space buffer to copy the data to.
6016 
6017  SystemInformationLength - Supplies the length of the user buffer.
6018 
6019  ReturnLength - Supplies the actual length of the data returned.
6020 
6021 Return Value:
6022 
6023  Various NTSTATUS codes.
6024 
6025 --*/
6026 
6027 {
6028  ULONG TotalBytes;
6029  KIRQL OldIrql;
6030  NTSTATUS Status;
6031  PVOID NewTable;
6032  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES SystemPoolEntry;
6033  PPOOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES SystemPoolEntryEnd;
6034  SIZE_T SnappedBigTableSize;
6035  SIZE_T SnappedBigTableSizeInBytes;
6036 
6037  PSYSTEM_BIGPOOL_ENTRY UserPoolEntry;
6038  PSYSTEM_BIGPOOL_INFORMATION UserPoolInfo;
6039 
6040  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql () == PASSIVE_LEVEL);
6041 
6042  NewTable = NULL;
6043  Status = STATUS_SUCCESS;
6044 
6045  UserPoolInfo = (PSYSTEM_BIGPOOL_INFORMATION)SystemInformation;
6046  UserPoolEntry = &UserPoolInfo->AllocatedInfo[0];
6047  TotalBytes = FIELD_OFFSET(SYSTEM_BIGPOOL_INFORMATION, AllocatedInfo);
6048  UserPoolInfo->Count = 0;
6049 
6050  do {
6051 
6052  SnappedBigTableSize = PoolBigPageTableSize;
6053  SnappedBigTableSizeInBytes =
6054  SnappedBigTableSize * sizeof (POOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES);
6055 
6056  if (NewTable != NULL) {
6057  MiFreePoolPages (NewTable);
6058  }
6059 
6060  //
6061  // Use MiAllocatePoolPages for the temporary buffer so we won't have
6062  // to filter it out of the results before handing them back.
6063  //
6064 
6065  NewTable = MiAllocatePoolPages (NonPagedPool,
6066  SnappedBigTableSizeInBytes);
6067 
6068  if (NewTable == NULL) {
6069  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
6070  }
6071 
6072  OldIrql = ExAcquireSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock);
6073 
6074  if (SnappedBigTableSize >= PoolBigPageTableSize) {
6075 
6076  //
6077  // Success - our table is big enough to hold everything.
6078  //
6079 
6080  break;
6081  }
6082 
6083  ExReleaseSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
6084 
6085  } while (TRUE);
6086 
6087  RtlCopyMemory (NewTable,
6088  PoolBigPageTable,
6089  PoolBigPageTableSize * sizeof (POOL_TRACKER_BIG_PAGES));
6090 
6091  SnappedBigTableSize = PoolBigPageTableSize;
6092 
6093  ExReleaseSpinLockExclusive (&ExpLargePoolTableLock, OldIrql);
6094 
6095  SystemPoolEntry = NewTable;
6096  SystemPoolEntryEnd = SystemPoolEntry + SnappedBigTableSize;
6097 
6098  //
6099  // Wrap the user space accesses with an exception handler so we can
6100  // free the temp buffer if the user address was bogus.
6101  //
6102 
6103  try {
6104  while (SystemPoolEntry < SystemPoolEntryEnd) {
6105 
6106  if (((ULONG_PTR)SystemPoolEntry->Va & POOL_BIG_TABLE_ENTRY_FREE) == 0) {
6107 
6108  //
6109  // This entry is in use so capture it.
6110  //
6111 
6112  UserPoolInfo->Count += 1;
6113  TotalBytes += sizeof (SYSTEM_BIGPOOL_ENTRY);
6114 
6115  if (SystemInformationLength < TotalBytes) {
6116  Status = STATUS_INFO_LENGTH_MISMATCH;
6117  }
6118  else {
6119  UserPoolEntry->VirtualAddress = SystemPoolEntry->Va;
6120 
6121  if (MmDeterminePoolType (SystemPoolEntry->Va) == NonPagedPool) {
6122  UserPoolEntry->NonPaged = 1;
6123  }
6124 
6125  UserPoolEntry->TagUlong = SystemPoolEntry->Key & ~PROTECTED_POOL;
6126  UserPoolEntry->SizeInBytes = SystemPoolEntry->NumberOfPages << PAGE_SHIFT;
6127  UserPoolEntry += 1;
6128  }
6129  }
6130  SystemPoolEntry += 1;
6131  }
6132  }
6133  except (EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER) {
6134  Status = GetExceptionCode ();
6135  }
6136 
6137  MiFreePoolPages (NewTable);
6138 
6139  if (ARGUMENT_PRESENT(ReturnLength)) {
6140  *ReturnLength = TotalBytes;
6141  }
6142 
6143  return Status;
6144 }
6145 
6146 VOID
6147 ExAllocatePoolSanityChecks (
6148  IN POOL_TYPE PoolType,
6149  IN SIZE_T NumberOfBytes
6150  )
6151 
6152 /*++
6153 
6154 Routine Description:
6155 
6156  This function performs sanity checks on the caller.
6157 
6158 Return Value:
6159 
6160  None.
6161 
6162 Environment:
6163 
6164  Only enabled as part of the driver verification package.
6165 
6166 --*/
6167 
6168 {
6169  if (NumberOfBytes == 0) {
6170  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6171  0x0,
6172  KeGetCurrentIrql(),
6173  PoolType,
6174  NumberOfBytes);
6175  }
6176 
6177  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
6178 
6179  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > APC_LEVEL) {
6180 
6181  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6182  0x1,
6183  KeGetCurrentIrql(),
6184  PoolType,
6185  NumberOfBytes);
6186  }
6187  }
6188  else {
6189  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > DISPATCH_LEVEL) {
6190 
6191  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6192  0x2,
6193  KeGetCurrentIrql(),
6194  PoolType,
6195  NumberOfBytes);
6196  }
6197  }
6198 }
6199 
6200 VOID
6201 ExFreePoolSanityChecks (
6202  IN PVOID P
6203  )
6204 
6205 /*++
6206 
6207 Routine Description:
6208 
6209  This function performs sanity checks on the caller.
6210 
6211 Return Value:
6212 
6213  None.
6214 
6215 Environment:
6216 
6217  Only enabled as part of the driver verification package.
6218 
6219 --*/
6220 
6221 {
6222  PPOOL_HEADER Entry;
6223  POOL_TYPE PoolType;
6224  PVOID StillQueued;
6225 
6226  if (P <= (PVOID)(MM_HIGHEST_USER_ADDRESS)) {
6227  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6228  0x10,
6229  (ULONG_PTR)P,
6230  0,
6231  0);
6232  }
6233 
6234  if ((ExpPoolFlags & EX_SPECIAL_POOL_ENABLED) &&
6235  (MmIsSpecialPoolAddress (P))) {
6236 
6237  KeCheckForTimer (P, PAGE_SIZE - BYTE_OFFSET (P));
6238 
6239  //
6240  // Check if an ERESOURCE is currently active in this memory block.
6241  //
6242 
6243  StillQueued = ExpCheckForResource(P, PAGE_SIZE - BYTE_OFFSET (P));
6244  if (StillQueued != NULL) {
6245  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6246  0x17,
6247  (ULONG_PTR)StillQueued,
6248  (ULONG_PTR)-1,
6249  (ULONG_PTR)P);
6250  }
6251 
6252  ExpCheckForWorker (P, PAGE_SIZE - BYTE_OFFSET (P)); // bugchecks inside
6253  return;
6254  }
6255 
6256  if (PAGE_ALIGNED(P)) {
6257  PoolType = MmDeterminePoolType(P);
6258 
6259  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
6260  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > APC_LEVEL) {
6261  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6262  0x11,
6263  KeGetCurrentIrql(),
6264  PoolType,
6265  (ULONG_PTR)P);
6266  }
6267  }
6268  else {
6269  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > DISPATCH_LEVEL) {
6270  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6271  0x12,
6272  KeGetCurrentIrql(),
6273  PoolType,
6274  (ULONG_PTR)P);
6275  }
6276  }
6277 
6278  //
6279  // Just check the first page.
6280  //
6281 
6282  KeCheckForTimer(P, PAGE_SIZE);
6283 
6284  //
6285  // Check if an ERESOURCE is currently active in this memory block.
6286  //
6287 
6288  StillQueued = ExpCheckForResource(P, PAGE_SIZE);
6289 
6290  if (StillQueued != NULL) {
6291  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6292  0x17,
6293  (ULONG_PTR)StillQueued,
6294  PoolType,
6295  (ULONG_PTR)P);
6296  }
6297  }
6298  else {
6299 
6300  if (((ULONG_PTR)P & (POOL_OVERHEAD - 1)) != 0) {
6301  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6302  0x16,
6303  __LINE__,
6304  (ULONG_PTR)P,
6305  0);
6306  }
6307 
6308  Entry = (PPOOL_HEADER)((PCHAR)P - POOL_OVERHEAD);
6309 
6310  if ((Entry->PoolType & POOL_TYPE_MASK) == 0) {
6311  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6312  0x13,
6313  __LINE__,
6314  (ULONG_PTR)Entry,
6315  Entry->Ulong1);
6316  }
6317 
6318  PoolType = (Entry->PoolType & POOL_TYPE_MASK) - 1;
6319 
6320  if ((PoolType & BASE_POOL_TYPE_MASK) == PagedPool) {
6321  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > APC_LEVEL) {
6322  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6323  0x11,
6324  KeGetCurrentIrql(),
6325  PoolType,
6326  (ULONG_PTR)P);
6327  }
6328  }
6329  else {
6330  if (KeGetCurrentIrql() > DISPATCH_LEVEL) {
6331  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6332  0x12,
6333  KeGetCurrentIrql(),
6334  PoolType,
6335  (ULONG_PTR)P);
6336  }
6337  }
6338 
6339  if (!IS_POOL_HEADER_MARKED_ALLOCATED(Entry)) {
6340  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6341  0x14,
6342  __LINE__,
6343  (ULONG_PTR)Entry,
6344  0);
6345  }
6346 
6347  KeCheckForTimer(Entry, (ULONG)(Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT));
6348 
6349  //
6350  // Check if an ERESOURCE is currently active in this memory block.
6351  //
6352 
6353  StillQueued = ExpCheckForResource(Entry, (ULONG)(Entry->BlockSize << POOL_BLOCK_SHIFT));
6354 
6355  if (StillQueued != NULL) {
6356  KeBugCheckEx (DRIVER_VERIFIER_DETECTED_VIOLATION,
6357  0x17,
6358  (ULONG_PTR)StillQueued,
6359  PoolType,
6360  (ULONG_PTR)P);
6361  }
6362  }
6363 }

6365 #if defined (NT_UP)
6366 VOID
6367 ExpBootFinishedDispatch (
6368  IN PKDPC Dpc,
6369  IN PVOID DeferredContext,
6370  IN PVOID SystemArgument1,
6371  IN PVOID SystemArgument2
6372  )
6373 
6374 /*++
6375 
6376 Routine Description:
6377 
6378  This function is called when the system has booted into a shell.
6379 
6380  It's job is to disable various pool optimizations that are enabled to
6381  speed up booting and reduce the memory footprint on small machines.
6382 
6383 Arguments:
6384

6386

6390

6393 Return Value:
6394 
6395  None.
6396

6398 
6399  DISPATCH_LEVEL since this is called from a timer expiration.
6400 
6401 --*/
6402 
6403 {

6405  UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER (DeferredContext);
6406  UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER (SystemArgument1);
6407  UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER (SystemArgument2);
6408

6411  // use lookaside lists and stop trying to separate regular allocations
6412  // as well.
6413  //
6414 
6415  RtlInterlockedAndBitsDiscardReturn (&ExpPoolFlags, (ULONG)~EX_SEPARATE_HOT_PAGES_DURING_BOOT);
6416 }
